fields.lore: Although lacking in traditional incantations, Nortrom's pedigree of the Aeol Drias gives him uncanny wisdom, which he applies to physical combat.
fields.description:
Silencer enchants his glaives with his wisdom, dealing additional damage based on his Intelligence. 

Glaives of Wisdom is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Glaives of Wisdom

fields.lore: Nortrom ensures that spells uttered by his opponents will be their last.
fields.description: Enchants a target damaging and silencing them if they cast a spell. If the enchantment expires the target will be disarmed in addition to being damaged and silenced.
fields.name: Last Word
fields.notes: Channeling abilities will trigger this affect once the caster finishes its channel.

fields.lore: Although lacking in traditional incantations, Nortrom's pedigree of the Aeol Drias gives him uncanny wisdom, which he applies to physical combat.

fields.lore: With a shock to the ground, all magic and sound pauses, and Nortrom fulfills his prophecy.
fields.description:
Silencer stops all sound, preventing enemy heroes and units on the map from casting spells.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Global Silence
fields.notes: This skill works on invisible and magic immune units, but gaining magic immunity will remove its effect.

fields.lore: Nortrom's lack of incantations is less of a problem for him than it is for his adversaries.
fields.description: Curses the target area, causing enemy Heroes to take damage and lose mana until they cast a spell.
fields.name: Curse of the Silent

fields.lore: A foul odor precedes a toxic, choking gas, emanating from the Butcher's putrid, ever-swelling mass.
fields.description: A toxic cloud that deals intense damage and slows movement--harming not only enemy units but Pudge himself.
fields.name: Rot
fields.notes: Using Rot doesn't interrupt channeling. Rot hits invisible units. If Pudge is silenced, he can't deactivate Rot if it's activated. Pudge can deny himself with this ability.

fields.lore: The Butcher's hook is a symbolic nightmare, its curved blade a frightening reminder of his slaughterous intent.
fields.description: Launches a bloody hook at a unit or location. The hook will snag the first unit it encounters, dragging the unit back to Pudge and dealing damage if it is an enemy.
fields.name: Meat Hook
fields.notes: Interrupts channeling spells of the primary target if it's an enemy. Meat Hook hits invisible units. Meat Hook can go through trees, cliffs, buildings, and mechanical units. Meat Hook can drag friendly units, but they won't be damaged.

fields.lore: The Butcher's hook is a symbolic nightmare, its curved blade a frightening reminder of his slaughterous intent.

fields.lore: 'When I'm through with these vermin, they'll be fit for a pie!'
fields.description:
CHANNELED - Pudge chows down on an enemy unit, disabling it and dealing damage over time. Lasts 3 seconds on Heroes, 6 seconds on creeps.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Dismember
fields.notes: Dismember will disable magic immune units, but not damage them. If a unit becomes invisible while Dismembered, it will still be under the effects of Dismember.

fields.lore: The Butcher gives new meaning to the words 'meat shield.'
fields.description: Gives Pudge resistance to magic damage, as well as bonus strength that increases each time Pudge kills an enemy Hero or it dies in his vicinity.  Flesh Heap is retroactive, meaning it can gain charges before it is skilled, which then become active.
fields.name: Flesh Heap
fields.notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

fields.lore: The Rogue Knight's iron gauntlet, taken from the school of his father, strikes his foes to their core.
fields.description: Sven unleashes his magical gauntlet that deals damage and stuns enemy units.
fields.name: Storm Hammer

fields.lore: Calling a few lines from the Vigil Codex fortifies Sven's obedience to his rogue code. So poetic!
fields.description: Sven's Warcry heartens his allies for battle, increasing their movement speed and armor.  Lasts 7 seconds.
fields.name: Warcry
fields.notes: Fully stacks with other armor and speed granting abilities.

fields.lore: The Rogue Knight's iron gauntlet, taken from the school of his father, strikes his foes to their core.
fields.description: Sven unleashes his magical gauntlet that deals damage and stuns enemy units.
fields.name: Storm Hammer

fields.lore: The Rogue Knight's iron gauntlet, taken from the school of his father, strikes his foes to their core.
fields.description: Sven unleashes his magical gauntlet that deals damage and stuns enemy units.
fields.name: Storm Hammer

fields.lore: With the strength that shattered the Sacred Helm, the Rogue Knight stands unopposed in melee combat.
fields.description: Sven channels his rogue strength, granting bonus damage for 25 seconds.
fields.name: God's Strength
fields.notes: The bonus damage is based on base damage and the primary attribute of Sven.

fields.lore: The Rogue Knight's iron gauntlet, taken from the school of his father, strikes his foes to their core.
fields.description: Sven unleashes his magical gauntlet that deals damage and stuns enemy units.
fields.name: Storm Hammer

fields.lore: The Vigil Knights still seek to reclaim the stolen Outcast Blade from Sven, a weapon capable of cutting wide swaths through lesser warriors.
fields.description: Sven strikes with great force, cleaving all nearby enemy units with his attack.
fields.name: Great Cleave
fields.notes: Cleave damage is reduced by armor type but not by armor value. Cleave damage goes through magic immunity. The cleave damages a circular area in front of Sven.

fields.lore: The Nishian totem splits the world to its core with tectonic force.
fields.description: Slams the ground with a mighty totem, fissuring the earth while stunning and damaging enemy units in a line.  Creates an impassable ridge of stone.
fields.name: Fissure

fields.lore: The earth trembles beneath the mighty footsteps of Raigor.
fields.description: Causes the earth to shake underfoot, adding additional damage and stuns to nearby enemy units when Earthshaker casts his abilities.
fields.name: Aftershock
fields.notes: Using items does not trigger Aftershock.

fields.lore: The Nishian totem splits the world to its core with tectonic force.
fields.description: Slams the ground with a mighty totem, fissuring the earth while stunning and damaging enemy units in a line.  Creates an impassable ridge of stone.
fields.name: Fissure

fields.lore: Raigor's gorilla strength can destroy mountains.
fields.description: Empowers Earthshaker's totem, causing it to deal extra damage on the next attack.
fields.name: Enchant Totem
fields.notes: Bonus damage is based on base damage and that given by primary attribute.

fields.lore: The Nishian totem splits the world to its core with tectonic force.
fields.description: Slams the ground with a mighty totem, fissuring the earth while stunning and damaging enemy units in a line.  Creates an impassable ridge of stone.
fields.name: Fissure

fields.lore: Tectonic plates crack, mountains fold, and foes are crushed by the Echo Slam.
fields.description:
Shockwaves travel through the ground, damaging enemy units.  Each enemy hit causes an echo to damage nearby units.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Echo Slam
fields.notes: Will not damage ethereal units. The initial damage will go through magic immunity; the additional damage will not. Units creating echoes also take damage from the wave they produced.

fields.notes: Bonus damage is based on base damage and that given by primary attribute.

fields.lore: Raigor's gorilla strength can destroy mountains.
fields.description: Empowers Earthshaker's totem, causing it to deal extra damage on the next attack.
fields.name: Enchant Totem
fields.notes: Bonus damage is based on base damage and that given by primary attribute.

fields.lore: Tectonic plates crack, mountains fold, and foes are crushed by the Echo Slam.
fields.description:
Shockwaves travel through the ground, damaging enemy units.  Each enemy hit causes an echo to damage nearby units.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Echo Slam
fields.notes: Will not damage ethereal units. The initial damage will go through magic immunity; the additional damage will not. Units creating echoes also take damage from the wave they produced.

fields.description: Allows manipulation of ice elements and grants a permanent strength bonus. Each Quas instance provides increased health regeneration.
fields.name: Quas
fields.notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

fields.lore: So begins a new age of knowledge.
fields.description:
Combines the properties of the elements currently being manipulated, creating a new spell at the Invoker's disposal. Click the help button to see the list of possible spells.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Invoke
fields.notes: The arrangement of instances does not matter.

fields.description: Allows manipulation of storm elements and grants a permanent agility bonus. Each Wex instance provides increased attack speed and movement speed.

fields.notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

fields.lore: A stolen prowess from the goddess Nyctasha is to put his prey into forever sleep.
fields.description: Puts the target enemy or friendly Hero to sleep and deals damage per second.  Sleeping units are awakened when attacked, but the Nightmare passes to the attacking unit.  The nightmared unit instantly wakes up if it takes damage.
fields.name: Nightmare
fields.notes: Nightmare deals damage to allies and himself, so it can be used to deny heroes or himself. Any source of damage except Nightmare will awaken the unit, but only physical attacks cause the Nightmare to be transferred. In the first second of Nightmare, the unit is invulnerable. Bane can wake himself up from Nightmare.

fields.lore: Atropos finds no greater pleasure than to harvest the fear he creates.
fields.description: Feasts on the vital energies of an enemy unit, dealing damage and gaining health equal to the damage dealt.
fields.name: Brain Sap
fields.notes: Bane always receives the full amount of health, regardless of the amount of damage dealt.

fields.lore: Atropos finds no greater pleasure than to harvest the fear he creates.

fields.description:
CHANNELED - Grips an enemy unit, disabling it and causing heavy damage over time, while stealing mana every second based on the unit's maximum mana.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Fiend's Grip
fields.notes: Fiend's Grip will disable and drain mana from magic immune units, but not damage them.

fields.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.
fields.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage.  Each jump deals less damage.
fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.lore: Even the Grandest Magus may use his powers for enjoyment.
fields.description: Rubick uses his telekinetic powers to lift the enemy into the air briefly and then hurls them back at the ground. The unit lands on the ground with such force that it stuns nearby enemies.
fields.name: Telekinesis
fields.notes: While the target is in the air, Rubick may use a secondary ability to throw the enemy in a targeted direction. When the unit lands, it isn't affected by the area of effect stun. The farthest you can throw an enemy is 375.

fields.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.
fields.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage.  Each jump deals less damage.
fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.lore: Not every magus can be a Grand Magus...
fields.description: Rubick's mastery of the arcane protects his allies against weaker magics, granting them magic resistance.
fields.name: Null Field
fields.notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

fields.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.
fields.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage.  Each jump deals less damage.
fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.lore: ...but even their lesser magics can be a source of much utility.
fields.description:
Rubick studies the trace magical essence of one enemy hero, learning the secrets of the last spell the hero cast. Rubick can use this spell as his own for several minutes or until he dies.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Spell Steal
fields.notes: Cannot steal item abilities.

fields.lore: Crixalis often lies in wait, burrowing under the surface to ambush his adversaries.
fields.description: Sand King burrows into the ground and tunnels forward, damaging and stunning enemy units above him as he resurfaces.
fields.name: Burrowstrike

fields.lore: Some say Crixalis is a mirage; his carapace appearing then vanishing between the whirling sands of the Scintillant Waste.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Sand King creates a fearsome sandstorm that damages enemy units while hiding him from vision.  The invisibility remains for a short duration after the sandstorm ends.
fields.name: Sand Storm
fields.notes: Sand Storm can be used to dodge projectiles.

fields.lore: Crixalis often lies in wait, burrowing under the surface to ambush his adversaries.

fields.description: Sand King burrows into the ground and tunnels forward, damaging and stunning enemy units above him as he resurfaces.
fields.name: Burrowstrike

fields.lore: Many an explorer was lost to the quicksands of the Scintillant Waste.
fields.description:
CHANNELED - After channeling for 2 seconds, Sand King sends a disturbance into the earth, causing it to shudder violently. All enemies caught within range will take damage and become slowed. Each subsequent pulse increases the radius of damage dealt.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Epicenter
fields.notes: The pulses are centered on Sand King, not where he first casted the spell. The pulses have gradually inreasing radius: 275 / 325 / 375 / 425 / 475 / 525 / 575 / 650 / 675 / 700 ( 775 / 825 *).

fields.lore: Crixalis often lies in wait, burrowing under the surface to ambush his adversaries.

fields.name: Sand Storm

fields.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.
fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.
fields.name: Sacred Arrow
fields.notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds. Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.

fields.lore: Both friend and foe alike recognize Mirana's iconic white beast in the heat of battle.
fields.description: Mirana leaps forward into battle, empowering allied units with a ferocious roar that grants bonus attack and movement speed. Speed bonus lasts 10 seconds.
fields.name: Leap
fields.notes: You can use Leap to dodge incoming projectiles.

fields.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.
fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.
fields.name: Sacred Arrow
fields.notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds. Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.

fields.lore: The Goddess breaks the strata to empower her Princess in the time of need.
fields.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. One random enemy unit in 175 range will take a second hit for 75% of the damage.
fields.name: Starstorm
fields.notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere. Starstorm cannot hit invisible units. Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.

fields.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.
fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.
fields.name: Sacred Arrow
fields.notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds. Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.

fields.lore: Her tenure with Selemene allows Mirana to eclipse the ground, wrapping her allies in a cloak of shadows.
fields.description: Turns Mirana and all allied heroes invisible. If Invisibility is broken, it will restore after fade delay if the shadow's duration has not expired.  Silence will stop Moonlight Shadow.
fields.name: Moonlight Shadow
fields.notes: Units affected will not auto attack enemies. Magic immune allies will be affected.

fields.lore: Shifting water makes it difficult to discern the nature of Morphling.
fields.description: Morphling shifts its form, pulling points from Strength and pouring them into Agility. The process is reversible.  Additional points in Morph increase the rate of stat change.  Passively grants bonus Agility.
fields.name: Morph (Agility Gain)
fields.notes: Morph works while Morphling is disabled, but not when silenced. Morph can't convert stats from items.

fields.lore: A torrential flood takes enemies by force.
fields.description: Morphling dissolves into liquid and surges forward, damaging enemy units in his path.  Morphling is invulnerable during Waveform.
fields.name: Waveform

fields.description: Morphling dissolves into liquid and surges forward, damaging enemy units in his path.  Morphling is invulnerable during Waveform.

fields.lore: Staring into Morphling produces a reflection that mimics the beholder.
fields.description: Morphling replicates any hero, friend or foe, although only dealing 50% the original hero's damage.  At any time, Morphling can instantly take the position of the Replicate.
fields.name: Replicate
fields.notes: You can't target yourself with Replicate.

fields.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.
fields.description: Slark leaps forward, grabbing the first hero he connects with.  That unit takes damage and is leashed to Slark, and can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
fields.name: Pounce
fields.notes: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of 933.33, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled 700 distance. Magic immune units cannot be leashed. Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location. Blinking or teleporting can break the leash.

fields.lore: With each strike at his adversaries, Slark's knowledge of their weaknesses improves.
fields.description: Slark steals the life essence of enemy heroes with his attacks, draining each of their attributes and converting them to bonus Agility.
fields.name: Essence Shift
fields.notes: Attributes cannot be dropped below 1. When either Slark or the affected unit dies, the stats are returned to normal.

fields.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.
fields.description: Slark leaps forward, grabbing the first hero he connects with.  That unit takes damage and is leashed to Slark, and can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
fields.name: Pounce
fields.notes: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of 933.33, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled 700 distance. Magic immune units cannot be leashed. Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location. Blinking or teleporting can break the leash.

fields.lore: Slithereen are capable of quickly regrowing appendages, in case of critical injury, to save their own lives.
fields.description: After a short delay, Slark sacrifices some of his life blood, purging negative debuffs and dealing damage to enemy units around him and to himself.  Slark only takes 50% of the damage.
fields.name: Dark Pact
fields.notes: 1.5 seconds after cast, a series of 10 pulses separated by 0.1 seconds deal the damage. Each pulse also removes buffs from Slark. You can't kill yourself with this skill. The pulses stop if Slark dies.

fields.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.

fields.lore: The hidden Thirteenth is a slippery foe.
fields.description: When used, Slark hides himself in a cloud of shadows, becoming immune to detection (attacking, casting spells, and using items do not reveal Slark).  Passively, when not visible to the enemy team, Slark gains bonus movement speed and health regeneration.
fields.name: Shadow Dance
fields.notes: If Slark is damaged by a neutral unit, the effect is lost for 2 seconds.

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: The last remnant of his heritage's commitment to bladework, Yurnero ensures that the style is remembered.
fields.description: Gives Juggernaut a chance to deal double damage on each attack.
fields.name: Blade Dance

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: Of the rituals learned at the Isle of Masks, tending wounds with a bit of voodoo magic has proven to be quite useful.
fields.description: Summons a Healing Ward that heals all nearby allied units, based on their max hit points.  The Healing Ward can move at 450 movement speed after being summoned.  Lasts 25 seconds.
fields.name: Healing Ward
fields.notes: The healing ward can be controlled. Multiple healing wards don't stack.

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: 'The fruits of discipline; with practice comes strength.'
fields.description:
Juggernaut leaps towards the target enemy unit with a damaging attack, and then slashes other nearby enemy units, dealing between 175-250 damage per slash.  Juggernaut is invulnerable for the duration.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Omnislash
fields.notes: Interrupts channeling spells of the primary target. Can target magic immune units. Slashes happen on an interval of 0.4 seconds. Creeps are killed in one hit of omnislash. You can use items during Omnislash.

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: The last remnant of his heritage's commitment to bladework, Yurnero ensures that the style is remembered.
fields.description: Gives Juggernaut a chance to deal double damage on each attack.
fields.name: Blade Dance

fields.lore: Lyralei enchants gusts of winds to fight incoming attacks.
fields.description: Increases movement speed and adds evasion from all physical attacks, while slowing movement of nearby enemies.
fields.name: Windrun
fields.notes: The slow will affect enemies with magic immunity. Windrun will not evade projectiles that were created before it was activated.

fields.lore: During her early years of training, Lyralei learned to fire powerful arrows that cleaved even trees to reach their targets.
fields.description: Windranger charges her bow for up to 1 second for a single powerful shot. The arrow deals damage to enemy units and destroys trees in its path. Damage is greatest on first target, and reduces by 10% for each target it pierces thereafter.  If the channeling is cancelled early, the shot will still occur but deal less damage.
fields.name: Powershot
fields.notes: The arrow initially moves at 3000 units per second, but slowed a little each time it hits an enemy or tree. Powershot will destroy trees in its area of effect.

fields.lore: During her early years of training, Lyralei learned to fire powerful arrows that cleaved even trees to reach their targets.
fields.description: Windranger charges her bow for up to 1 second for a single powerful shot. The arrow deals damage to enemy units and destroys trees in its path. Damage is greatest on first target, and reduces by 10% for each target it pierces thereafter.  If the channeling is cancelled early, the shot will still occur but deal less damage.
fields.name: Powershot
fields.notes: The arrow initially moves at 3000 units per second, but slowed a little each time it hits an enemy or tree. Powershot will destroy trees in its area of effect.

fields.lore: Windranger's variety of bow skills includes an arrow with thick ropes attached to encumber any escaping target.
fields.description: Shackles the target to an enemy unit or tree in a line directly behind it.  If no unit or tree is present, the stun duration is reduced to 0.75.
fields.name: Shackleshot
fields.notes: This spell can shackle two enemies together, stunning them both. Can shackle the target to an enemy unit or tree at most 525/500 behind it. Shackleshot cannot be disjointed.

fields.lore: During her early years of training, Lyralei learned to fire powerful arrows that cleaved even trees to reach their targets.
fields.description: Windranger charges her bow for up to 1 second for a single powerful shot. The arrow deals damage to enemy units and destroys trees in its path. Damage is greatest on first target, and reduces by 10% for each target it pierces thereafter.  If the channeling is cancelled early, the shot will still occur but deal less damage.
fields.name: Powershot
fields.notes: The arrow initially moves at 3000 units per second, but slowed a little each time it hits an enemy or tree. Powershot will destroy trees in its area of effect.

fields.lore: Twisting nature to his vile will, the shifting earth consumes those unlucky enough to cross Leshrac's path.
fields.description: Splits the earth under enemies. Deals damage and stuns for a short duration.
fields.name: Split Earth
fields.notes: Split Earth will destroy trees in its area of effect. There is a 0.35 second delay before the effect is applied.

fields.lore: Chronoptic energy bursts from one plane to the other, evaporating anything it touches.
fields.description: Saturates the area around Leshrac with magical explosions that deal mixed damage to enemy units and structures.  The fewer units available to attack, the more damage those units will take.  Lasts 8 seconds.
fields.name: Diabolic Edict
fields.notes: Damage is not reduced by damage block. The explosions will continue even if Leshrac is killed. Can damage buildings, magic immune units, and invisible units.

fields.lore: Twisting nature to his vile will, the shifting earth consumes those unlucky enough to cross Leshrac's path.
fields.description: Splits the earth under enemies. Deals damage and stuns for a short duration.
fields.name: Split Earth
fields.notes: Split Earth will destroy trees in its area of effect. There is a 0.35 second delay before the effect is applied.

fields.lore: Chronoptic energy bursts from one plane to the other, evaporating anything it touches.
fields.description: Saturates the area around Leshrac with magical explosions that deal mixed damage to enemy units and structures.  The fewer units available to attack, the more damage those units will take.  Lasts 8 seconds.
fields.name: Diabolic Edict
fields.notes: Damage is not reduced by damage block. The explosions will continue even if Leshrac is killed. Can damage buildings, magic immune units, and invisible units.

fields.description: Splits the earth under enemies. Deals damage and stuns for a short duration.
fields.name: Split Earth
fields.notes: Split Earth will destroy trees in its area of effect. There is a 0.35 second delay before the effect is applied.

fields.lore: Lucifer's appetite and greed are never sated.
fields.description: Consumes an enemy or neutral creep, acquiring any special abilities that it possessed.
fields.name: Devour
fields.notes: Gives Doom the original bounty of the creep, along with the bonus gold. The amount of time it takes to Devour depends on the current HP of the unit. Doom can't Devour mechanical or ancient units. If you devour a creep without abilities, you'll keep the abilities you had previously.

fields.lore: The Fallen One spreads destruction in his wake, sparing none from the flame which sustains him.
fields.description: Carpets the nearby earth in flames, damaging enemies while Doom gains bonus HP regen and increased movement speed.
fields.name: Scorched Earth
fields.notes: Scorched Earth follows Doom, centered on his location. Other units Doom controls also benefit from Scorched Earth.

fields.lore: Lucifer's appetite and greed are never sated.
fields.description: Consumes an enemy or neutral creep, acquiring any special abilities that it possessed.
fields.name: Devour
fields.notes: Gives Doom the original bounty of the creep, along with the bonus gold. The amount of time it takes to Devour depends on the current HP of the unit. Doom can't Devour mechanical or ancient units. If you devour a creep without abilities, you'll keep the abilities you had previously.

fields.lore: The Fallen One spreads destruction in his wake, sparing none from the flame which sustains him.
fields.description: Carpets the nearby earth in flames, damaging enemies while Doom gains bonus HP regen and increased movement speed.
fields.name: Scorched Earth
fields.notes: Scorched Earth follows Doom, centered on his location. Other units Doom controls also benefit from Scorched Earth.

fields.lore: Lucifer shares the fire branding bestowed upon him at the time of his exile.
fields.description: Dissipates a piece of an enemy Hero's soul, mini-stunning and dealing bonus damage equal to 20% of the target's maximum health when the enemy's level is a multiple of a specific number or 25.
fields.name: LVL? Death
fields.notes: Interrupts channeling abilities.

fields.lore: When a name is tolled from the bell of Vashundol, doom is sure to follow.
fields.description:
Inflicts a curse that prevents an enemy Hero from casting spells or using items, while taking damage over time.  Doom also disables most passive abilities and removes positive buffs on cast. 

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Doom
fields.notes: Doom damages units through magic immunity. Units afflicted by Doom can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.

fields.lore: Stolen from one of Admiral Kunkka's flagships, Leviathan's heavy anchor proves useful as a melee weapon.
fields.description: Tidehunter swings his mighty anchor to damage nearby enemies and reduce their attack damage.
fields.name: Anchor Smash

fields.lore: During his championship of the Sunken Isles, Leviathan gained mastery over the open sea.
fields.description: Summons a gush of water to damage an enemy unit, reducing their movement speed and armor.  Lasts 4 seconds.
fields.name: Gush

fields.lore: Stolen from one of Admiral Kunkka's flagships, Leviathan's heavy anchor proves useful as a melee weapon.
fields.description: Tidehunter swings his mighty anchor to damage nearby enemies and reduce their attack damage.
fields.name: Anchor Smash

fields.lore: Claddish navymen tell tales of a mighty sea-faring beast that suffered spear and sword but continued to lay waste to the fleet.
fields.description:
Creates a thick armor shell that reduces physical damage and removes negative buffs when damage received reaches a critical threshold.

Kraken Shell does not stack with items that provide Damage Block.
fields.name: Kraken Shell
fields.notes: Only damage from player owned sources is counted towards buff removal. The counter will reset if no player owned damage is taken for 6 seconds. Kraken Shell removes most buffs, even if they are generally not purgable.

fields.lore: Stolen from one of Admiral Kunkka's flagships, Leviathan's heavy anchor proves useful as a melee weapon.
fields.description: Tidehunter swings his mighty anchor to damage nearby enemies and reduce their attack damage.
fields.name: Anchor Smash

fields.lore: Calling to the abyssal god Maelrawn has resulted in entire armadas being lost at sea.
fields.description: Slams the ground, causing tentacles to erupt in all directions, damaging and stunning all nearby enemy units.
fields.name: Ravage
fields.notes: Ravage will hit invisible units. Ravage waves move outwards at a speed of 775.

fields.lore: Poison from the Nether Reaches turns wounds into fatalities, and fatigue into death.
fields.description: Nethertoxin causes Viper's normal attack to deal bonus damage to units based on how much health they are missing.  The bonus damage doubles for each 20% of health missing from the target.   Nethertoxin deals half damage to creeps and buildings.
fields.name: Nethertoxin

fields.lore: The Netherdrake's inborn toxic breath quickly drains the vitality of its afflicted.
fields.description:
Intensifies Viper's venom, adding an effect to his normal attack that slows attack and movement speed while dealing damage over time.

Poison Attack is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Poison Attack
fields.notes: Successive casts don't increase slow or damage, but refresh the duration.

fields.lore: Poison from the Nether Reaches turns wounds into fatalities, and fatigue into death.
fields.description: Nethertoxin causes Viper's normal attack to deal bonus damage to units based on how much health they are missing.  The bonus damage doubles for each 20% of health missing from the target.   Nethertoxin deals half damage to creeps and buildings.
fields.name: Nethertoxin

fields.lore: It is not unusual for sword and shield alike to corrode in the very hands of those who attack the Netherdrake.
fields.description: Viper exudes an infectious toxin that damages and slows any enemy that damages it. The acid exudate also increases Viper's resistance to spells.
fields.name: Corrosive Skin
fields.notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

fields.lore: Poison from the Nether Reaches turns wounds into fatalities, and fatigue into death.

fields.notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

fields.lore: Once used to slay his sadistic summoner, the most powerful of Netherdrake infections spreads through the veins of those foolish enough to cross Viper.
fields.description:
Viper slows the targeted enemy unit's movement and attack speed while also dealing poison damage over time.  The slowing effect reduces over the duration of the poison.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Viper Strike
fields.notes: Slow works on magic immune units. Units afflicted by Viper Strike can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.

fields.lore: A swift crush of might and water breaks even the toughest of defenses.
fields.description: Slams the ground, stunning and damaging nearby enemy land units.  After the stun, the affected units are slowed.
fields.name: Slithereen Crush

fields.lore: As Slardar has made the transition from the Deeps, it has been necessary to use his powerful tail for sprinting instead of swimming.
fields.description: Slardar moves significantly faster, but takes bonus damage.
fields.name: Sprint
fields.notes: Activating this skill doesn't interrupt channeling abilities. The damage amplification from Mask of Madness doesn't stack with Sprint.

fields.lore: A swift crush of might and water breaks even the toughest of defenses.
fields.description: Slams the ground, stunning and damaging nearby enemy land units.  After the stun, the affected units are slowed.
fields.name: Slithereen Crush

fields.lore: As Slardar has made the transition from the Deeps, it has been necessary to use his powerful tail for sprinting instead of swimming.

fields.description: Slams the ground, stunning and damaging nearby enemy land units.  After the stun, the affected units are slowed.
fields.name: Slithereen Crush

fields.lore: Slardar's lure-light reveals even the most hidden of opponents, as well as their vulnerabilities.
fields.description: Reduces enemy armor to amplify physical damage and provides True Sight of the targeted unit, revealing invisibility.
fields.name: Amplify Damage
fields.notes: Gives True Sight and shared vision of the target. Works on magic immune units.

fields.lore: A swift crush of might and water breaks even the toughest of defenses.
fields.description: Slams the ground, stunning and damaging nearby enemy land units.  After the stun, the affected units are slowed.
fields.name: Slithereen Crush

fields.lore: Thieves of the wealth of the Deep Ones meet the brutality of the Slithereen Guard in melee combat.
fields.description: Grants a chance that an attack will do bonus damage and stun an enemy.  The duration is doubled against creeps.
fields.name: Bash
fields.notes: Stun works on magic immune units. Does not stack with Skull Basher.

fields.lore: A stolen prowess from the goddess Nyctasha is to put his prey into forever sleep.
fields.description: Puts the target enemy or friendly Hero to sleep and deals damage per second.  Sleeping units are awakened when attacked, but the Nightmare passes to the attacking unit.  The nightmared unit instantly wakes up if it takes damage.
fields.name: Nightmare
fields.notes: Nightmare deals damage to allies and himself, so it can be used to deny heroes or himself. Any source of damage except Nightmare will awaken the unit, but only physical attacks cause the Nightmare to be transferred. In the first second of Nightmare, the unit is invulnerable. Bane can wake himself up from Nightmare.

fields.lore: Atropos finds no greater pleasure than to harvest the fear he creates.
fields.description: Feasts on the vital energies of an enemy unit, dealing damage and gaining health equal to the damage dealt.
fields.name: Brain Sap
fields.notes: Bane always receives the full amount of health, regardless of the amount of damage dealt.

fields.lore: Atropos finds no greater pleasure than to harvest the fear he creates.
fields.description: Feasts on the vital energies of an enemy unit, dealing damage and gaining health equal to the damage dealt.
fields.name: Brain Sap
fields.notes: Bane always receives the full amount of health, regardless of the amount of damage dealt.

fields.lore: Even the mightiest of warriors crumble before the terror of Atropos.
fields.description: Weakens an enemy unit, reducing its physical damage.  Lasts 20 seconds.
fields.name: Enfeeble
fields.notes: Enfeeble cannot be purged.

fields.lore: Atropos finds no greater pleasure than to harvest the fear he creates.
fields.description: Feasts on the vital energies of an enemy unit, dealing damage and gaining health equal to the damage dealt.
fields.name: Brain Sap
fields.notes: Bane always receives the full amount of health, regardless of the amount of damage dealt.

fields.lore: Victims of Atropos are frequently torn apart by vivid conjurations of their own nightmares.
fields.description:
CHANNELED - Grips an enemy unit, disabling it and causing heavy damage over time, while stealing mana every second based on the unit's maximum mana.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Fiend's Grip
fields.notes: Fiend's Grip will disable and drain mana from magic immune units, but not damage them.

fields.description: Puts the target enemy or friendly Hero to sleep and deals damage per second.  Sleeping units are awakened when attacked, but the Nightmare passes to the attacking unit.  The nightmared unit instantly wakes up if it takes damage.
fields.name: Nightmare
fields.notes: Nightmare deals damage to allies and himself, so it can be used to deny heroes or himself. Any source of damage except Nightmare will awaken the unit, but only physical attacks cause the Nightmare to be transferred. In the first second of Nightmare, the unit is invulnerable. Bane can wake himself up from Nightmare.

fields.lore: Victims of Atropos are frequently torn apart by vivid conjurations of their own nightmares.
fields.description:
CHANNELED - Grips an enemy unit, disabling it and causing heavy damage over time, while stealing mana every second based on the unit's maximum mana.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Fiend's Grip
fields.notes: Fiend's Grip will disable and drain mana from magic immune units, but not damage them.

fields.lore: Twisting nature to his vile will, the shifting earth consumes those unlucky enough to cross Leshrac's path.
fields.description: Splits the earth under enemies. Deals damage and stuns for a short duration.
fields.name: Split Earth
fields.notes: Split Earth will destroy trees in its area of effect. There is a 0.35 second delay before the effect is applied.

fields.lore: The Tormented Soul's mastery of the elements is evident in the massive storms that strike down armies before him.
fields.description: Summons a lightning storm that blasts the target enemy unit, then jumps to nearby enemy units.
fields.name: Lightning Storm
fields.notes: The lightning searches in a 650 area.

fields.lore: Chronoptic energy bursts from one plane to the other, evaporating anything it touches.
fields.description: Saturates the area around Leshrac with magical explosions that deal mixed damage to enemy units and structures.  The fewer units available to attack, the more damage those units will take.  Lasts 8 seconds.
fields.name: Diabolic Edict
fields.notes: Damage is not reduced by damage block. The explosions will continue even if Leshrac is killed. Can damage buildings, magic immune units, and invisible units.

fields.lore: If necessary, the Tormented Soul can manipulate space time itself, ravaging lesser beings.
fields.description:
Creates waves of damaging energy around Leshrac, one per second, to damage nearby enemy units.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Pulse Nova
fields.notes: Will not deal damage if Leshrac is invisible.

fields.lore: Sylla's lifelong companion is symbiotic with his spirit and heart, coming to aid him in any time of need.
fields.description: Summons a powerful Spirit Bear companion that can equip items.  If the bear moves 1100 distance away from the Lone Druid, it cannot attack.  If the Spirit Bear dies, the Lone Druid suffers composite damage as backlash.  As the bear increases in levels, it can learn the Return, Entangling Claws, and Demolish abilities.  Spirit Bear does not benefit from attributes.
fields.name: Summon Spirit Bear
fields.notes: Most spells interact with the Spirit Bear in the same way as they do with heroes. You can't resummon the bear if it has taken damage in the past 3 seconds.

fields.lore: Sylla studies and masters the arts of the lost Bear Clan, enhancing his attunement with the wild.
fields.description: Increases the Lone Druid's synergy with his Spirit Bear and himself, upgrading attributes and abilities.
fields.name: Synergy

fields.lore: The mighty bear is the king of the forest, possessing the throne through raw power.
fields.description: Lone Druid learns to morph himself into a raging bear, losing his ranged advantage and some base movement speed, but gaining melee power as well as the Battle Cry ability.  He can morph freely between druid and bear form.
fields.name: True Form
fields.notes: You can dodge stuns during the 2 second duration of transforming.

fields.lore: Bears are not commonly seen as being agile creatures, but can actually move rather quickly, especially when enraged.
fields.description: Increases the attack and movement speed of Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear.
fields.name: Rabid

fields.lore: Sylla studies and masters the arts of the lost Bear Clan, enhancing his attunement with the wild.
fields.description: Increases the Lone Druid's synergy with his Spirit Bear and himself, upgrading attributes and abilities.
fields.name: Synergy

fields.description: Return to Druid form.
fields.name: Druid Form

fields.lore: Bears are not commonly seen as being agile creatures, but can actually move rather quickly, especially when enraged.
fields.description: Increases the attack and movement speed of Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear.
fields.name: Rabid

fields.name: Rabid

fields.description: Return to Druid form.
fields.name: Druid Form

fields.lore: Although lacking in traditional incantations, Nortrom's pedigree of the Aeol Drias gives him uncanny wisdom, which he applies to physical combat.
fields.description:
Silencer enchants his glaives with his wisdom, dealing additional damage based on his Intelligence. 

Glaives of Wisdom is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Glaives of Wisdom

fields.lore: Nortrom ensures that spells uttered by his opponents will be their last.
fields.description: Enchants a target damaging and silencing them if they cast a spell. If the enchantment expires the target will be disarmed in addition to being damaged and silenced.
fields.name: Last Word
fields.notes: Channeling abilities will trigger this affect once the caster finishes its channel.

fields.lore: Nortrom ensures that spells uttered by his opponents will be their last.
fields.description: Enchants a target damaging and silencing them if they cast a spell. If the enchantment expires the target will be disarmed in addition to being damaged and silenced.
fields.name: Last Word
fields.notes: Channeling abilities will trigger this affect once the caster finishes its channel.

fields.lore: Nortrom's lack of incantations is less of a problem for him than it is for his adversaries.
fields.description: Curses the target area, causing enemy Heroes to take damage and lose mana until they cast a spell.
fields.name: Curse of the Silent

fields.lore: Nortrom ensures that spells uttered by his opponents will be their last.
fields.description: Enchants a target damaging and silencing them if they cast a spell. If the enchantment expires the target will be disarmed in addition to being damaged and silenced.
fields.name: Last Word
fields.notes: Channeling abilities will trigger this affect once the caster finishes its channel.

fields.lore: With a shock to the ground, all magic and sound pauses, and Nortrom fulfills his prophecy.
fields.description:
Silencer stops all sound, preventing enemy heroes and units on the map from casting spells.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Global Silence
fields.notes: This skill works on invisible and magic immune units, but gaining magic immunity will remove its effect.

fields.lore: Harvested souls swirl in and out of the Abysm, empowering the Shadow Fiend to increase the size of his collection.
fields.description: Shadow Fiend steals the soul from units he kills, gaining bonus damage. If the killed unit is a hero, he gains 12 souls.  On death, he releases half of them from bondage.
fields.name: Necromastery
fields.notes: Denies, neutral creeps, and buildings also provide bonus damage through Necromastery.

fields.lore: Nevermore's trademark for harvesting souls.
fields.description: Shadow Fiend razes the area in front of him, dealing damage to enemy units in an area.
fields.name: Shadowraze

fields.lore: Nevermore's trademark for harvesting souls.

fields.lore: The captured souls of those past slain are released to ravage their former allies.
fields.description: Captured souls are used to deal massive damage, as well as slowing and reducing the attack damage of nearby enemy units. Requiem of Souls creates one wave of damage for every 2 souls stored by Necromastery.  The closest enemy units are hit the hardest.  Requiem has a 1 second cast time before it is activated.  Requiem of Souls is automatically cast when Shadow Fiend dies, independent of its cooldown.
fields.name: Requiem of Souls
fields.notes: One line is generated around Nevermore, 1 per 2 souls, for a maximum of 18 lines.

fields.lore: Even being near Nevermore eats away at one's soul.
fields.description: Shadow Fiend's presence reduces the armor of nearby enemies.
fields.name: Presence of the Dark Lord
fields.notes: Stacks fully with other armor reduction abilities and aura.

fields.lore: The roots and tendrils of the Treant Protectors are far-reaching, stimulating the growth and rejuvenation of all of nature.
fields.description: Infuses the target hero or structure with a protective coating which grants bonus regeneration. Also blocks some damage from all sources . Dispels when a number of damage instances are taken.
fields.name: Living Armor
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap.

fields.lore: Rooftrellen nurtures the beings under his stewardship, sustained by the lifeforce of trespassers into his sacred ground.
fields.description: Treant plants a life-sapping seed in an enemy unit, draining its health, while simultaneously slowing it. The seed heals friendly units around it equal to the amount drained.  Pulses 6 times.
fields.name: Leech Seed

fields.lore: The roots and tendrils of the Treant Protectors are far-reaching, stimulating the growth and rejuvenation of all of nature.
fields.description: Infuses the target hero or structure with a protective coating which grants bonus regeneration. Also blocks some damage from all sources . Dispels when a number of damage instances are taken.
fields.name: Living Armor
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap.

fields.lore: The Protectors don't often come into vision; their natural state being nestled within their leafy brethren.
fields.description: Causes the targeted unit to blend in with the forest, becoming invisible to enemies and gaining a movement speed bonus when near a tree.  If the unit moves away from a tree or the spell is cast on a unit with no nearby trees, Nature's Guise is lost.  Treant Protector can cast spells and remain invisible under Nature's Guise.
fields.name: Nature's Guise
fields.notes: If cast on a unit that isn't near a tree, it will lose the invisibility almost instantly. Nature's Guise checks in 1 second intervals for nearby trees, removing invisibility if none are found.

fields.lore: The roots and tendrils of the Treant Protectors are far-reaching, stimulating the growth and rejuvenation of all of nature.
fields.description: Infuses the target hero or structure with a protective coating which grants bonus regeneration. Also blocks some damage from all sources . Dispels when a number of damage instances are taken.
fields.name: Living Armor
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap.

fields.lore: Rooftrellen calls the ancestral spirit of nature, releasing its power through all of his kin.
fields.description: Summons an overgrowth of vines and branches around Treant that prevent afflicted enemies from moving, blinking, going invisible, or attacking.
fields.name: Overgrowth
fields.notes: Works on magic immune units, but if units gain magic immunity after the effect starts, they'll break free.

fields.lore: A silver lining to the failure of turning a mountain into gold, this volatile solution has destructive potential.
fields.description: Alchemist brews up an unstable concoction that he can throw at an enemy hero, to stun and deal damage in an area around the explosion. The longer the concoction brews, the more damage it deals and the longer the stun. After 5 seconds, the brew reaches its maximum damage and stun time. However, after 5.5 seconds, the concoction will explode on Alchemist himself if not thrown.
fields.name: Unstable Concoction
fields.notes: Alchemist can move and act normally while brewing. A timer above Alchemist's head will indicate the remaining brew time. Maximum effects are achieved after 5 seconds. You can deny yourself with this skill. Unstable Concoction cannot be disjointed.

fields.lore: Using traditional Alchemy from the Darkbrew family, Razzil concocts an acid that dissolves even the toughest metals.
fields.description: Sprays high-pressure acid across a target area. Enemy units who step across the contaminated terrain take mixed damage per second and have their armor reduced.
fields.name: Acid Spray
fields.notes: Hits magic immune units.

fields.lore: Using traditional Alchemy from the Darkbrew family, Razzil concocts an acid that dissolves even the toughest metals.

fields.notes: Alchemist can move and act normally while brewing. A timer above Alchemist's head will indicate the remaining brew time. Maximum effects are achieved after 5 seconds. You can deny yourself with this skill. Unstable Concoction cannot be disjointed.

fields.lore: Using traditional Alchemy from the Darkbrew family, Razzil concocts an acid that dissolves even the toughest metals.
fields.description: Sprays high-pressure acid across a target area. Enemy units who step across the contaminated terrain take mixed damage per second and have their armor reduced.
fields.name: Acid Spray
fields.notes: Hits magic immune units.

fields.lore: The brew Razzil gave to the Ogre during their prison bust has become a useful potion in the midst of combat.
fields.description: Alchemist causes his Ogre to enter a chemically induced rage, reducing base attack cooldown and increasing movement speed and regeneration.
fields.name: Chemical Rage
fields.notes: Has a 0.35 second transformation time, which can be used to dodge projectiles and stuns.

fields.lore: A silver lining to the failure of turning a mountain into gold, this volatile solution has destructive potential.
fields.description: Alchemist brews up an unstable concoction that he can throw at an enemy hero, to stun and deal damage in an area around the explosion. The longer the concoction brews, the more damage it deals and the longer the stun. After 5 seconds, the brew reaches its maximum damage and stun time. However, after 5.5 seconds, the concoction will explode on Alchemist himself if not thrown.
fields.name: Unstable Concoction
fields.notes: Alchemist can move and act normally while brewing. A timer above Alchemist's head will indicate the remaining brew time. Maximum effects are achieved after 5 seconds. You can deny yourself with this skill. Unstable Concoction cannot be disjointed.

fields.name: Acid Spray
fields.notes: Hits magic immune units.

The longer the concoction brews, the more damage it deals and the longer the stun. After 5 seconds, the brew reaches its maximum damage and stun time. However, after 5.5 seconds, the concoction will explode on Alchemist himself if not thrown.
fields.name: Unstable Concoction
fields.notes: Alchemist can move and act normally while brewing. A timer above Alchemist's head will indicate the remaining brew time. Maximum effects are achieved after 5 seconds. You can deny yourself with this skill. Unstable Concoction cannot be disjointed.

fields.lore: While it is not a mountain, Razzil has mastered the conversion of smaller compounds to line his pockets.
fields.description: Alchemist gets bonus gold for killing creeps; the bonus stacks if the creeps are killed within a period of time, after which the count is reset.  The bonus gold is capped at 30 gold.
fields.name: Greevil's Greed

fields.lore: The brew Razzil gave to the Ogre during their prison bust has become a useful potion in the midst of combat.
fields.description: Alchemist causes his Ogre to enter a chemically induced rage, reducing base attack cooldown and increasing movement speed and regeneration.

fields.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
fields.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
fields.name: Nether Blast
fields.notes: Damage is delayed by 0.9 seconds.

fields.lore: While at the lamasery for the Arts of Oblivion, Pugna learned to dominate his classmates with a simple ward charged with Nether magic.
fields.description: Pugna places a nether ward that fires mana flares at enemy heroes who dare to cast spells, while also preventing them from regenerating mana.  Nether Ward deals damage equal to the damage multiplier times the mana spent by the enemy hero.  Lasts 25 seconds.
fields.name: Nether Ward
fields.notes: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect. Nether Ward can be decrepified. Nether Ward has 3 HP. Heroes can attack it for 1 damage, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.

fields.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
fields.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
fields.name: Nether Blast
fields.notes: Damage is delayed by 0.9 seconds.

fields.lore: While at the lamasery for the Arts of Oblivion, Pugna learned to dominate his classmates with a simple ward charged with Nether magic.

fields.name: Nether Ward
fields.notes: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect. Nether Ward can be decrepified. Nether Ward has 3 HP. Heroes can attack it for 1 damage, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.

fields.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
fields.name: Nether Blast
fields.notes: Damage is delayed by 0.9 seconds.

fields.lore: Pugna has truly become more powerful than even the grandmaster of Oblivion.
fields.description:
CHANNELED - While channelling Life Drain, Pugna siphons HP of the target enemy unit. If you are full HP, it will restore mana instead. Lasts 10 seconds.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Life Drain
fields.notes: HP drained depends on the actual damage dealt. Illusions are destroyed on the first tick of damage.

fields.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
fields.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
fields.name: Nether Blast
fields.notes: Damage is delayed by 0.9 seconds.

fields.lore: A now-mastered relic from his childhood, Pugna delights in banishing others into the Nether Realm, whether for good, evil, or simple enjoyment.
fields.description: A powerful banishing spell that slows a unit and renders it unable to attack or be attacked. Afflicted units take extra magic damage.
fields.name: Decrepify
fields.notes: Only magical and pure damage can affect a unit under the effects of Decrepify.

fields.lore: While at the lamasery for the Arts of Oblivion, Pugna learned to dominate his classmates with a simple ward charged with Nether magic.

fields.notes: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect. Nether Ward can be decrepified. Nether Ward has 3 HP. Heroes can attack it for 1 damage, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.

fields.lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.
fields.description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback.  Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14 seconds.
fields.name: Quill Spray
fields.notes: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.

fields.lore: Having caught a cold while stuck in the snow, Bristleback turns it to his advantage.
fields.description: Covers a target in snot, causing it to have reduced armor and movement speed.  Multiple casts stack and refresh the duration.
fields.name: Viscous Nasal Goo

fields.lore: Turning his back to a fight might be just the thing.
fields.description: Bristleback takes less damage if hit on the sides or rear.  If Bristleback takes 250 damage from the rear, he releases a Quill Spray of the current level.
fields.name: Bristleback
fields.notes: Bristleback's rear is considered to be within 70 degrees from the back. Bristleback's side is considered to be within 110 degrees from the back.

fields.lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.
fields.description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback.  Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14 seconds.
fields.name: Quill Spray
fields.notes: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.

fields.lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.
fields.description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback.  Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14 seconds.
fields.name: Quill Spray
fields.notes: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.

fields.lore: 'Temper, temper,' his mum always chided.  But in a fight, a temper can come in handy.
fields.description: Bristleback works himself up into a fury every time he casts a spell, increasing his movement speed and damage.  The first stack (base) provides larger bonuses.
fields.name: Warpath
fields.notes: Bristleback's illusions will receive the bonuses. Items will not trigger Warpath.

fields.lore: One of the few Dezun rites used for offensive purposes, the paralytic enchantment often proves useful.
fields.description:
Casts a poisonous spell on an enemy unit, causing damage and slowness over time, and eventual paralysis.  Poison Touch mini-stuns on impact. Slow increases per level.

Level 1 slows the target by 33% during the set time.

Level 2 slows the target by 33% for 2 seconds, then by 66% for 1 second.

Level 3 slows the target by 33%, 66%, and 100%, for one second respectively.

Level 4 slows the target by 33%, then slows the target by 66% for 1 second, then stuns the target for 1 second.
fields.name: Poison Touch
fields.notes: The damage is not reduced by damage block abilities. The initial ministun will cancel channeling.

fields.lore: While it is a simplistic and routine rite among Shadow Priests, the Shadow Wave is also the most critical for success.
fields.description: Shadow Wave heals several allies, which in turn cause damage equal to their healing in a small area around them.  Dazzle is always healed by Shadow Wave, and it does not count toward the number of targets.
fields.name: Shadow Wave
fields.notes: Prioritizes allied heroes over creeps. If enemies are near multiple allied units affected by Shadow Wave, they can take multiple instances of damage.

fields.lore: Only a seasoned acolyte of the Shadow can properly perform the rite of preventing death.
fields.description: An ally blessed with Shallow Grave, no matter how close to death, cannot die while under its protection.
fields.name: Shallow Grave
fields.notes: HP cannot go below 1 while under the effects of Shallow Grave, but Axe's Culling Blade will still kill the hero.

fields.lore: One of the few Dezun rites used for offensive purposes, the paralytic enchantment often proves useful.
fields.description:

Level 1 slows the target by 33% during the set time.

Level 3 slows the target by 33%, 66%, and 100%, for one second respectively.

Level 4 slows the target by 33%, then slows the target by 66% for 1 second, then stuns the target for 1 second.
fields.name: Poison Touch
fields.notes: The damage is not reduced by damage block abilities. The initial ministun will cancel channeling.

fields.lore: His ethereal journey into the Nothl realm has allowed Dazzle to mend together the powers of light and dark, creating shifting waves of enchantments.
fields.description:
Applies a buff that increases allied hero armor or decreases enemy hero armor in the target area over time.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Weave
fields.notes: Places a buff on units, so entering or leaving the area after the cast has no effect.

fields.description:

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Weave
fields.notes: Places a buff on units, so entering or leaving the area after the cast has no effect.

fields.lore: A concoction of various stings, poisons, and toxins gathered from the jungles of Jidi Isle, victims surviving it are rare.
fields.description: Launches a ball of venom in a line, poisoning enemy units so that they take both initial damage and damage over time, as well as suffering slowed movement.  Venomous Gale deals damage every 3 seconds over its duration.
fields.name: Venomous Gale
fields.notes: Units afflicted by Venomous Gale can be denied when their HP drops below 25%. Duration damage is dealt every 3 seconds. Slow starts at 50%, and decreases as time passes.

fields.lore: A mixture of his old herbalist talents and newfound toxic mastery creates a living embodiment of plague.
fields.description: Summons a plague ward to attack enemy units and structures. The ward is immune to magic. Wards gain the Poison Sting level from Venomancer, dealing 50% of the full damage.
fields.name: Plague Ward

fields.lore: The paralytic sting of the creature which caused his transformation now belongs to the Venomancer.
fields.description: Adds poison damage to Venomancer's normal attacks, slowing movement speed.
fields.name: Poison Sting
fields.notes: Poison Sting damage can be lethal.

fields.lore: A mixture of his old herbalist talents and newfound toxic mastery creates a living embodiment of plague.
fields.description: Summons a plague ward to attack enemy units and structures. The ward is immune to magic. Wards gain the Poison Sting level from Venomancer, dealing 50% of the full damage.

fields.description: Summons a plague ward to attack enemy units and structures. The ward is immune to magic. Wards gain the Poison Sting level from Venomancer, dealing 50% of the full damage.
fields.name: Plague Ward

fields.lore: In the Acid Jungles, creatures releasing noxious poison to their attackers is common; Venomancer spreads this plague beyond the Jidi Isle.
fields.description:
A spreading ring of poison that does damage over time to enemy units around Venomancer.  Poison Nova's effect cannot bring units below 1 HP.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Poison Nova
fields.notes: Poison Nova cannot deal lethal damage (target will be left with 1 HP).

fields.lore: A mixture of his old herbalist talents and newfound toxic mastery creates a living embodiment of plague.
fields.description: Summons a plague ward to attack enemy units and structures. The ward is immune to magic. Wards gain the Poison Sting level from Venomancer, dealing 50% of the full damage.
fields.name: Plague Ward

fields.description: Adds poison damage to Venomancer's normal attacks, slowing movement speed.
fields.name: Poison Sting
fields.notes: Poison Sting damage can be lethal.

fields.description: Adds poison damage to Venomancer's normal attacks, slowing movement speed.
fields.name: Poison Sting
fields.notes: Poison Sting damage can be lethal.

fields.lore: The paralytic sting of the creature which caused his transformation now belongs to the Venomancer.
fields.description: Adds poison damage to Venomancer's normal attacks, slowing movement speed.
fields.name: Poison Sting
fields.notes: Poison Sting damage can be lethal.

fields.lore: Strygwyr becomes frenzied when blood is spilled.
fields.description: Enables Bloodseeker to sense enemy Heroes with health below a certain percentage, giving him vision of that unit, increased movement speed and increased damage. Bonuses stack per Hero.  Bloodseeker gains True Sight of enemy heroes below half their visiblity threshold.
fields.name: Thirst
fields.notes: Not triggered by Illusions.

fields.lore: Strygwyr shares his animalistic thirst for bloodshed.
fields.description: Drives a unit into a bloodthirsty rage, during which it has higher attack damage, but cannot cast spells and takes damage every second.  Bloodrage dispels the target before applying its buff.
fields.name: Bloodrage
fields.notes: Bloodrage can be cast on enemy and allied units, as well as Bloodseeker himself.

fields.lore: Flayed ones bathing in the blood of the recently fallen is a terrifying sight on the field of battle.
fields.description: Bloodseeker revels in combat, gaining health with every unit he kills or an enemy hero dies within a 325 radius of Bloodseeker.  The health gained is a percentage of the killed unit's maximum HP.
fields.name: Blood Bath
fields.notes: Denied creeps and heroes will also trigger Bloodbath, but illusions will not.

fields.lore: Strygwyr shares his animalistic thirst for bloodshed.
fields.description: Drives a unit into a bloodthirsty rage, during which it has higher attack damage, but cannot cast spells and takes damage every second.  Bloodrage dispels the target before applying its buff.
fields.name: Bloodrage
fields.notes: Bloodrage can be cast on enemy and allied units, as well as Bloodseeker himself.

fields.description: Bloodseeker revels in combat, gaining health with every unit he kills or an enemy hero dies within a 325 radius of Bloodseeker.  The health gained is a percentage of the killed unit's maximum HP.
fields.name: Blood Bath
fields.notes: Denied creeps and heroes will also trigger Bloodbath, but illusions will not.

fields.lore: When the Bloodseeker hunts you, injuries become fatalities.
fields.description: Causes an enemy unit's skin to rupture, dealing massive damage. If the unit moves while under the effect of Rupture, it takes a percentage of the distance traveled as damage.  The damage is dealt through magic immunity.
fields.name: Rupture

fields.description: Causes an enemy unit's skin to rupture, dealing massive damage. If the unit moves while under the effect of Rupture, it takes a percentage of the distance traveled as damage.  The damage is dealt through magic immunity.
fields.name: Rupture

fields.lore: The court jesters present during King Goff's assassination can recount no other image than a dancing shadow.
fields.description: Bounty Hunter becomes invisible and gains the ability to move through other units until he attacks or uses an ability.  If he breaks the invisibility with an attack, that attack will deal bonus damage.
fields.name: Shadow Walk
fields.notes: Will not break most channeling of spells upon activation. The bonus damage is a separate instance, and isn't considered in Jinada's calculation.

fields.lore: Whispering an enchantment he learned from Soruq to his faithful blades, Gondar targets vital tendons and joints to disable his opponents.
fields.description: Bounty Hunter plans his next hit, passively adding a critical strike and maim to his next attack.
fields.name: Jinada

fields.lore: While the shuriken may be small, Gondar's precise aim can cause critical damage.
fields.description: Hurls a deadly shuriken at an enemy unit, dealing damage and mini-stunning the target.
fields.name: Shuriken Toss
fields.notes: This spell interrupts channeling abilities.

fields.lore: Whispering an enchantment he learned from Soruq to his faithful blades, Gondar targets vital tendons and joints to disable his opponents.
fields.description: Bounty Hunter plans his next hit, passively adding a critical strike and maim to his next attack.
fields.name: Jinada

fields.lore: Whispering an enchantment he learned from Soruq to his faithful blades, Gondar targets vital tendons and joints to disable his opponents.
fields.description: Bounty Hunter plans his next hit, passively adding a critical strike and maim to his next attack.
fields.name: Jinada

fields.lore: Using his elevated senses of sight and smell, Gondar's hits have quite a good chance of success.
fields.description: Tracks an enemy hero, giving True Sight of it and grants a gain in movement speed to allies near the hunted. If the target dies, Bounty Hunter and nearby heroes collect a bounty in gold.
fields.name: Track
fields.notes: Bounty Hunter will get the bonus gold if the target dies while Track is active, regardless of how it died. Gives True Sight as well as shared vision of the target. Track's effect is only visible to allies. The allies that are receiving the bonus speed from Track are the ones that will receive the bonus gold. Bonus gold is reliable gold.

fields.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.
fields.description: Converts an area of trees into Treants. Treants have 550 hit points and deal 21-23 damage.
fields.name: Nature's Call
fields.notes: Nature's Call can only create as many trees there are in the target area. Treants have 20% magic resistance.

fields.lore: The Prophet keeps his sentinel over the forest, protecting it when in need.
fields.description: Teleports to any point on the map.
fields.name: Teleportation
fields.notes: Teleport takes 3 seconds to cast. Mana and cooldown take effect when the cast is completed.  Nature's Prophet will not use any mana or waste the cooldown if the spell is interrupted while casting. When the cast begins, an effect is created at the target location, which is visible to allies and enemies.

fields.notes: Nature's Call can only create as many trees there are in the target area. Treants have 20% magic resistance.

fields.lore: Nature's Prophet calls Verodicia's fury to strike down those who might ravage the wilderness.
fields.description:
Damaging energy bounces around the map, striking enemies close to the cast point that are in vision. Each enemy hit beyond the first adds damage.

Upgradable with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Wrath of Nature
fields.notes: Wrath of Nature will not hit units out of vision. Can be cast through the minimap; the nearest valid target will be selected.

fields.lore: The Prophet keeps his sentinel over the forest, protecting it when in need.
fields.description: Teleports to any point on the map.
fields.name: Teleportation
fields.notes: Teleport takes 3 seconds to cast. Mana and cooldown take effect when the cast is completed.  Nature's Prophet will not use any mana or waste the cooldown if the spell is interrupted while casting. When the cast begins, an effect is created at the target location, which is visible to allies and enemies.

fields.lore: Verdant overgrowth is a common ailment reported by Nature's Prophet's attackers.
fields.description: Sprouts a ring of trees around a unit, trapping it in place.
fields.name: Sprout
fields.notes: Sprout can be cast on any unit, or the ground. Trees created by Sprout have the same interactions with abilities as regular trees.

fields.lore: The first skill learned by the Sisters of the Veil often signals an incoming hit.
fields.description: Deals minor pure damage and slows the enemy unit's movement speed. Deals half damage to heroes.
fields.name: Stifling Dagger

fields.lore: Mortred's silken veil is the last thing her unfortunate target sees.
fields.description: Teleports to a unit, friendly or enemy, and grants bonus attack speed while attacking if it's an enemy unit.
fields.name: Phantom Strike

fields.lore: Meditation allows a Veiled Sister to carefully anticipate her opponents in combat.
fields.description: The Phantom Assassin becomes hard to see by blurring her body and disappearing from the enemy minimap when near enemy heroes. Some enemy attacks miss.
fields.name: Blur

fields.lore: The first skill learned by the Sisters of the Veil often signals an incoming hit.
fields.description: Deals minor pure damage and slows the enemy unit's movement speed. Deals half damage to heroes.

fields.description: Deals minor pure damage and slows the enemy unit's movement speed. Deals half damage to heroes.
fields.name: Stifling Dagger

fields.lore: A divine strike, Mortred honors her opponent by choosing them for death.
fields.description: Phantom Assassin refines her combat abilities, gaining a chance of delivering a devastating critical strike to enemy units. Stifling Dagger shares the same critical strike chance.
fields.name: Coup de Grace
