fields.lore: Lina's essence allows her to focus the sun's energies, causing air to combust at will.
fields.description: Summons a column of flames that damages and stuns enemies.
fields.name: Light Strike Array
fields.notes: Light Strike Array will destroy trees in its area of effect.

fields.lore: In the scorched barren of Misrule, Lina learned to manipulate the fiery breath of the Desert Wyrm as a form of entertainment.
fields.description: Lina channels the breath of a dragon, sending out a wave of fire that scorches every enemy in its path.
fields.name: Dragon Slave
fields.notes: Dragon Slave can hit units up to 1225 units away.

fields.lore: Dancing flames embody Lina's playful nature, bringing out her true blazing self.
fields.description: Grants bonus attack and movement speed each time Lina casts a spell. Stacks with itself. Lasts 9 seconds.
fields.name: Fiery Soul
fields.notes: Duration refreshes each time a new spell is cast. Using items does not trigger Fiery Soul.

fields.lore: In the scorched barren of Misrule, Lina learned to manipulate the fiery breath of the Desert Wyrm as a form of entertainment.
fields.description: Lina channels the breath of a dragon, sending out a wave of fire that scorches every enemy in its path.
fields.name: Dragon Slave
fields.notes: Dragon Slave can hit units up to 1225 units away.

fields.lore: In the scorched barren of Misrule, Lina learned to manipulate the fiery breath of the Desert Wyrm as a form of entertainment.
fields.description: Lina channels the breath of a dragon, sending out a wave of fire that scorches every enemy in its path.
fields.name: Dragon Slave
fields.notes: Dragon Slave can hit units up to 1225 units away.

fields.lore: The air around Lina becomes so intensely torrid that it scorches a foe that comes too close with white-hot lightning.
fields.description:
Fires off a bolt of lightning at a single enemy unit, dealing massive damage.

Upgradable with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Laguna Blade
fields.notes: Laguna Blade has a 0.25 delay before the damage is applied after the spell is cast, allowing certain abilities to avoid the damage.

fields.lore: In the scorched barren of Misrule, Lina learned to manipulate the fiery breath of the Desert Wyrm as a form of entertainment.

fields.description: Summons a column of flames that damages and stuns enemies.
fields.name: Light Strike Array
fields.notes: Light Strike Array will destroy trees in its area of effect.

fields.lore: Ostarion calls on his damned lineage, laying waste to his opponents.
fields.description: Wraith King sears an enemy unit with spectral fire, dealing damage and stunning, then dealing damage over time and slowing the target.
fields.name: Wraithfire Blast
fields.notes: Deals 80 / 160 / 230 / 300 total damage.

fields.lore: Wraith King's blade drains his enemy's essence to feed his aura.
fields.description: Nearby friendly units gain hit points based on their damage dealt when attacking enemy units.
fields.name: Vampiric Aura
fields.notes: Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

fields.lore: Ostarion calls on his damned lineage, laying waste to his opponents.
fields.description: Wraith King sears an enemy unit with spectral fire, dealing damage and stunning, then dealing damage over time and slowing the target.
fields.name: Wraithfire Blast
fields.notes: Deals 80 / 160 / 230 / 300 total damage.

fields.lore: One blow to crush a foe.
fields.description: Wraith King passively gains a chance to deal bonus damage on an attack.
fields.name: Mortal Strike

fields.lore: Ostarion calls on his damned lineage, laying waste to his opponents.
fields.description: Wraith King sears an enemy unit with spectral fire, dealing damage and stunning, then dealing damage over time and slowing the target.
fields.name: Wraithfire Blast
fields.notes: Deals 80 / 160 / 230 / 300 total damage.

fields.lore: Conspirators against the Wraith King wonder why he never stays dead.
fields.description: Wraith King's members regroup after death, allowing him to resurrect when killed in battle.  Upon death, enemy units in the area will be slowed by 50%.
fields.name: Reincarnation
fields.notes: Wraith King won't revive if he doesn't have enough mana. If Wraith King has an Aegis and Reincarnation off cooldown, Reincarnation will trigger first. Revives with full HP and Mana.

fields.lore: One of Clockwerk's inventions of which he is most proud is the power cog - though it is sometimes despised by his allies.
fields.description: Forms a barrier of energized cogs around Clockwerk, trapping any units that are near.  Enemies outside the trap that touch a cog are knocked back, losing health and mana. Once a cog has delivered a shock, it will power down.  Cogs can be destroyed by enemy attacks, but Clockwerk can destroy them with just one.
fields.name: Power Cogs
fields.notes: Cogs can shock invisible units.

fields.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
fields.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun.
fields.name: Battery Assault
fields.notes: Deals damage every 0.7 seconds. Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled. Total damage: 240/560/880/1200

fields.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
fields.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun.
fields.name: Battery Assault
fields.notes: Deals damage every 0.7 seconds. Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled. Total damage: 240/560/880/1200

fields.lore: What started as a festive display has become a useful scouting and bombardment tool.
fields.description: Fires a global range flare that explodes over a given area, damaging enemies and providing vision for 10 seconds.
fields.name: Rocket Flare

fields.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
fields.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun.
fields.name: Battery Assault
fields.notes: Deals damage every 0.7 seconds. Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled. Total damage: 240/560/880/1200

fields.lore: A somewhat unwieldy device, the Hookshot sends the otherwise clunky Clockwerk armor flying through the air.
fields.description:
Fires a grappling device rapidly at the target location.  If the hook hits a non-neutral unit, Clockwerk launches himself into the target, stunning and dealing damage.  Any enemies Clockwerk collides with along the way are subject to damage and stunned. 

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Hookshot
fields.notes: Hookshot will latch and take Clockwerk to allies, but not damage or disable them. Neutral creeps stop the hook with no effect.

fields.lore: Even the Grandest Magus may use his powers for enjoyment.
fields.description: Rubick uses his telekinetic powers to lift the enemy into the air briefly and then hurls them back at the ground. The unit lands on the ground with such force that it stuns nearby enemies.
fields.name: Telekinesis
fields.notes: While the target is in the air, Rubick may use a secondary ability to throw the enemy in a targeted direction. When the unit lands, it isn't affected by the area of effect stun. The farthest you can throw an enemy is 375.

fields.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.
fields.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage.  Each jump deals less damage.
fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.
fields.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage.  Each jump deals less damage.
fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.notes: While the target is in the air, Rubick may use a secondary ability to throw the enemy in a targeted direction. When the unit lands, it isn't affected by the area of effect stun. The farthest you can throw an enemy is 375.

fields.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage.  Each jump deals less damage.
fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.lore: ...but even their lesser magics can be a source of much utility.
fields.description:
Rubick studies the trace magical essence of one enemy hero, learning the secrets of the last spell the hero cast. Rubick can use this spell as his own for several minutes or until he dies.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Spell Steal
fields.notes: Cannot steal item abilities.

fields.description: Rubick's mastery of the arcane protects his allies against weaker magics, granting them magic resistance.
fields.name: Null Field
fields.notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

fields.description:
Rubick studies the trace magical essence of one enemy hero, learning the secrets of the last spell the hero cast. Rubick can use this spell as his own for several minutes or until he dies.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Spell Steal
fields.notes: Cannot steal item abilities.

fields.lore: Clinkz simply lights his arrows from his flaming essence for quite the destructive effect.
fields.description:
Imbues Clinkz's arrows with fire for extra damage.

Searing Arrows is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Searing Arrows
fields.notes: Searing Arrows deal damage to structures. The damage is directly added to Clinkz' attack damage, as physical damage.

fields.lore: It's hard to say whether the blur around the Bone Fletcher are from his flaming heart or his speed with the quiver.
fields.description: Clinkz attacks with a barrage of arrows.  Dramatically increases attack speed for a short time.
fields.name: Strafe

fields.lore: Clinkz simply lights his arrows from his flaming essence for quite the destructive effect.
fields.description:
Imbues Clinkz's arrows with fire for extra damage.

Searing Arrows is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Searing Arrows
fields.notes: Searing Arrows deal damage to structures. The damage is directly added to Clinkz' attack damage, as physical damage.

fields.lore: With a burst of fire and puff of smoke, the Bone Fletcher was nowhere to be seen.
fields.description: Clinkz moves invisibly through units until the moment he attacks or uses an ability.
fields.name: Skeleton Walk
fields.notes: Will not break most channeling of spells or items upon activation. Has a fadetime of 0.6 seconds.

fields.lore: Clinkz simply lights his arrows from his flaming essence for quite the destructive effect.

fields.lore: Sutherex' bond of life and death has become a part of Clinkz, and his old bones are refreshed with repetition of the pact on lesser beings.
fields.description: Clinkz consumes the target friendly or enemy creep, gaining a percent of its hitpoints as max health and damage.
fields.name: Death Pact
fields.notes: If the target is an enemy, Clinkz will gain the correct experience and gold. Increases Clinkz' current and max HP. When the duration ends, max HP returns to normal, but current HP stays the same.

fields.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.
fields.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
fields.name: Ether Shock
fields.notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.

fields.lore: A self-defense incantation, Rhasta developed shackles after his master was slain in the Bleeding Hills.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Magically binds an enemy unit so that it cannot move or attack, while dealing damage over time.
fields.name: Shackles

fields.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.
fields.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
fields.name: Ether Shock
fields.notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.

fields.lore: Rhasta often ended performances by turning himself into a chicken - now, the humiliation is shared.
fields.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless creature, disabling their attacks and abilities.
fields.name: Hex
fields.notes: Instantly destroys illusions. The target will have a base movement speed of 100, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled. Hex disables damage block and evasion.

fields.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.
fields.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
fields.name: Ether Shock
fields.notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.

fields.lore: Snake charming was a big part of the Shadow Shaman's act; now Rhasta can empower the snakes to do his bidding.
fields.description:
Summons 10 serpent wards to attack enemy units and structures. The wards are immune to magic, and have a small area of splash damage that increases per level.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Mass Serpent Ward
fields.notes: Serpent Wards deal piercing type splash damage. Serpent Wards deal 100% damage in a 50/75/85 radius. Serpent Wards deal 40% damage in a 75/100/110 radius. Serpent Wards deal 20% damage in a 150/200/220 radius.

fields.lore: Sylla's lifelong companion is symbiotic with his spirit and heart, coming to aid him in any time of need.
fields.description: Summons a powerful Spirit Bear companion that can equip items.  If the bear moves 1100 distance away from the Lone Druid, it cannot attack.  If the Spirit Bear dies, the Lone Druid suffers composite damage as backlash.  As the bear increases in levels, it can learn the Return, Entangling Claws, and Demolish abilities.  Spirit Bear does not benefit from attributes.
fields.name: Summon Spirit Bear
fields.notes: Most spells interact with the Spirit Bear in the same way as they do with heroes. You can't resummon the bear if it has taken damage in the past 3 seconds.

fields.lore: Bears are not commonly seen as being agile creatures, but can actually move rather quickly, especially when enraged.
fields.description: Increases the attack and movement speed of Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear.
fields.name: Rabid

fields.lore: Sylla's lifelong companion is symbiotic with his spirit and heart, coming to aid him in any time of need.

fields.name: Summon Spirit Bear
fields.notes: Most spells interact with the Spirit Bear in the same way as they do with heroes. You can't resummon the bear if it has taken damage in the past 3 seconds.

fields.lore: Sylla studies and masters the arts of the lost Bear Clan, enhancing his attunement with the wild.
fields.description: Increases the Lone Druid's synergy with his Spirit Bear and himself, upgrading attributes and abilities.
fields.name: Synergy

fields.lore: The mighty bear is the king of the forest, possessing the throne through raw power.
fields.description: Lone Druid learns to morph himself into a raging bear, losing his ranged advantage and some base movement speed, but gaining melee power as well as the Battle Cry ability.  He can morph freely between druid and bear form.
fields.name: True Form
fields.notes: You can dodge stuns during the 2 second duration of transforming.

fields.lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.
fields.description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy land units.
fields.name: Thunder Clap

fields.lore: The Order of the Oyo's solution to all problems - another round!
fields.description: Drenches a small area in alcohol, causing their movement speed to be reduced, and causing their attacks to have a chance to miss.
fields.name: Drunken Haze
fields.notes: Drunken Haze cannot be disjointed.

fields.lore: The Order of the Oyo's solution to all problems - another round!

fields.name: Drunken Haze

fields.description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy land units.
fields.name: Thunder Clap

fields.lore: It isn't clear whether Mangix is consciously aware of his potent bond with nature, as it often occurs in the midst of a drunken stupor.
fields.description:
Splits Brewmaster into elements, forming 3 specialized warriors, adept at survival. If any of them survive until the end of their summoned timer, the Brewmaster is reborn.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Primal Split
fields.notes: The Earth Element will carry all auras that the Brewmaster has, as well as True Sight. When the spell ends, Brewmaster will take the place of an element in this order, assuming they are alive: Earth, Storm, Fire.

fields.lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.
fields.description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy land units.
fields.name: Thunder Clap

fields.lore: When Mangix won his title as the Brewmaster of the Order of Oyo, he also claimed his place in the mastery of inebriation.
fields.description: Gives a chance to avoid attacks and to deal critical damage.
fields.name: Drunken Brawler
fields.notes: Does not stack with evasion from other sources.

fields.lore: The strength of the living is simply borrowed from the strength of the dead.
fields.description: Undying saps the life from enemy Heroes in an area, dealing damage and stealing Strength for the duration.
fields.name: Decay
fields.notes: The strength stolen stacks, but can't cause a hero to have strength below 1. The strength steal takes effect before the damage is dealt.

fields.lore: Dirge calls on his fallen brothers to fight for the Dead God.
fields.description: Summons a tombstone at the target point.  Zombies will frequently spawn next to every enemy unit in the area around the Tombstone, and attack them.  Zombies have the Deathlust ability, which causes their attacks to slow the target, and if the target reaches below a certain amount of health, increases the attack and movement speed of the zombie.
fields.name: Tombstone
fields.notes: Tombstone is magic immune, but can be healed by Soul Rip. Zombies and Tombstone are magic immune. If their initial target dies or goes out of vision, the Zombie will die.

fields.lore: Dirge calls on his fallen brothers to fight for the Dead God.
fields.description: Summons a tombstone at the target point.  Zombies will frequently spawn next to every enemy unit in the area around the Tombstone, and attack them. fields.lore: The flesh of the recently dead add to the power of Dirge's plague.
fields.description:
Undying transforms into a horrifying flesh golem that possesses a Plague Aura.  This aura slows all enemy units within 750 range and amplifies the damage they take; the closer to Undying, the more damage.  When a plagued unit dies, Undying is healed equal to a percentage of that unit's maximum health.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Flesh Golem
fields.notes: Undying is healed when affected units die in range, regardless of who killed it. Dying illusions don't trigger the heal.

fields.lore: Dirge calls on his fallen brothers to fight for the Dead God.

fields.lore: Even his allied Heroes feel despair in Undying's presence.
fields.description: Redirects the flow of energy through a target friendly or enemy unit, healing or damaging it depending on how many units are near Undying.  Each counted unit takes damage.
fields.name: Soul Rip
fields.notes: Can heal Tombstone, but can't heal or damage another buildings. The 25 damage dealt to each unit can't kill a unit.

fields.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.
fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.
fields.name: Sacred Arrow
fields.notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds. Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.

fields.lore: Both friend and foe alike recognize Mirana's iconic white beast in the heat of battle.
fields.description: Mirana leaps forward into battle, empowering allied units with a ferocious roar that grants bonus attack and movement speed. Speed bonus lasts 10 seconds.
fields.name: Leap
fields.notes: You can use Leap to dodge incoming projectiles.

fields.lore: The Goddess breaks the strata to empower her Princess in the time of need.
fields.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. One random enemy unit in 175 range will take a second hit for 75% of the damage.
fields.name: Starstorm
fields.notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere. Starstorm cannot hit invisible units. Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.

fields.lore: The Goddess breaks the strata to empower her Princess in the time of need.
fields.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. One random enemy unit in 175 range will take a second hit for 75% of the damage.
fields.name: Starstorm
fields.notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere. Starstorm cannot hit invisible units. Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.

fields.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. One random enemy unit in 175 range will take a second hit for 75% of the damage.
fields.name: Starstorm
fields.notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere. Starstorm cannot hit invisible units. Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.

fields.lore: Her tenure with Selemene allows Mirana to eclipse the ground, wrapping her allies in a cloak of shadows.
fields.description: Turns Mirana and all allied heroes invisible. If Invisibility is broken, it will restore after fade delay if the shadow's duration has not expired.  Silence will stop Moonlight Shadow.
fields.name: Moonlight Shadow
fields.notes: Units affected will not auto attack enemies. Magic immune allies will be affected.

fields.lore: The Goddess breaks the strata to empower her Princess in the time of need.
fields.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. One random enemy unit in 175 range will take a second hit for 75% of the damage.
fields.name: Starstorm
fields.notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere. Starstorm cannot hit invisible units. Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.

fields.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.
fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.
fields.name: Sacred Arrow
fields.notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds. Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.

fields.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.
fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.
fields.name: Sacred Arrow
fields.notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds. Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.

fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.

fields.lore: Her tenure with Selemene allows Mirana to eclipse the ground, wrapping her allies in a cloak of shadows.
fields.description: Turns Mirana and all allied heroes invisible. If Invisibility is broken, it will restore after fade delay if the shadow's duration has not expired.  Silence will stop Moonlight Shadow.
fields.name: Moonlight Shadow
fields.notes: Units affected will not auto attack enemies. Magic immune allies will be affected.

fields.lore: Both friend and foe alike recognize Mirana's iconic white beast in the heat of battle.
fields.description: Mirana leaps forward into battle, empowering allied units with a ferocious roar that grants bonus attack and movement speed. Speed bonus lasts 10 seconds.
fields.name: Leap
fields.notes: You can use Leap to dodge incoming projectiles.

fields.lore: Both friend and foe alike recognize Mirana's iconic white beast in the heat of battle.
fields.description: Mirana leaps forward into battle, empowering allied units with a ferocious roar that grants bonus attack and movement speed. Speed bonus lasts 10 seconds.
fields.name: Leap
fields.notes: You can use Leap to dodge incoming projectiles.

fields.lore: Both friend and foe alike recognize Mirana's iconic white beast in the heat of battle.
fields.description: Mirana leaps forward into battle, empowering allied units with a ferocious roar that grants bonus attack and movement speed. Speed bonus lasts 10 seconds.
fields.name: Leap
fields.notes: You can use Leap to dodge incoming projectiles.

fields.lore: Her tenure with Selemene allows Mirana to eclipse the ground, wrapping her allies in a cloak of shadows.
fields.description: Turns Mirana and all allied heroes invisible. If Invisibility is broken, it will restore after fade delay if the shadow's duration has not expired.  Silence will stop Moonlight Shadow.
fields.name: Moonlight Shadow
fields.notes: Units affected will not auto attack enemies. Magic immune allies will be affected.

fields.lore: The Demon Witch exercises his demonic covenant, opening a fissure from hell.
fields.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
fields.name: Earth Spike
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second.

fields.lore: Lion is compelled to share his transfiguration, twisting the essence of those who oppose him.
fields.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless beast, with all special abilities disabled.
fields.name: Hex
fields.notes: Instantly destroys illusions. The target will have a base movement speed of 100, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled. Hex disables damage block and evasion.

fields.lore: The Demon Witch exercises his demonic covenant, opening a fissure from hell.
fields.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
fields.name: Earth Spike
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second.

fields.lore: Lesser magi are nothing more than a source of magical restoration for the Demon Witch.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Absorbs the magical energies of a target enemy unit by taking mana from it every second.
fields.name: Mana Drain
fields.notes: Destroys illusions after 0.25 seconds.

fields.lore: The Demon Witch exercises his demonic covenant, opening a fissure from hell.
fields.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
fields.name: Earth Spike
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second.

fields.lore: Lion's disfigured hand is also the source of his greatest power, capable of flooding victims with malefic force.
fields.description:
Rips at an enemy unit, trying to turn it inside-out. Deals massive damage.

Upgradable with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Finger of Death
fields.notes: Finger of Death has a 0.25 delay before the damage is applied after the spell is cast, allowing certain abilities to avoid the damage.

fields.lore: Axe is the only reinforcement this army needs.
fields.description: When attacked, Axe performs a helix counter attack, dealing damage to all nearby enemies.
fields.name: Counter Helix
fields.notes: Counter Helix checks for triggering whenever an attack against Axe begins, not when Axe is actually damaged by said attack.

fields.lore: Mogul Khan's warcry taunts opponents into engaging in an unconquerable battle with the Axe.
fields.description: Axe taunts nearby enemy units, forcing them to attack him, while he gains bonus armor during the duration.
fields.name: Berserker's Call
fields.notes: Affects units with magic immunity.

fields.lore: Axe is the only reinforcement this army needs.
fields.description: When attacked, Axe performs a helix counter attack, dealing damage to all nearby enemies.
fields.name: Counter Helix
fields.notes: Counter Helix checks for triggering whenever an attack against Axe begins, not when Axe is actually damaged by said attack.

fields.lore: Ordinary heroes cannot withstand Mogul Khan's rage for battle, such that it injures them until it is satisfied.
fields.description: Enrages an enemy unit, causing it to be slowed and take damage over time until it kills another unit or the duration ends. Axe gains movement speed for each unit affected with Battle Hunger.
fields.name: Battle Hunger
fields.notes: Destroying buildings will also remove the debuff. Units affected by Battle Hunger cannot be denied.

fields.lore: Ordinary heroes cannot withstand Mogul Khan's rage for battle, such that it injures them until it is satisfied.
fields.description: Enrages an enemy unit, causing it to be slowed and take damage over time until it kills another unit or the duration ends. Axe gains movement speed for each unit affected with Battle Hunger.
fields.name: Battle Hunger
fields.notes: Destroying buildings will also remove the debuff. Units affected by Battle Hunger cannot be denied.

fields.lore: Mogul Khan is the embodiment of battle and fury, launching into a gruesome fatality against those who dare engage the Axe in combat.
fields.description:
Axe spots weakness and strikes, dealing moderate damage but instantly killing an enemy unit with low health.  When an enemy hero is killed in this way, the cooldown is reset. Axe and nearby allied units gain bonus movement speed.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Culling Blade
fields.notes: The killing blow goes through magic immunity.

fields.lore: In the fractal prison of Foulfell, Terrorblade learned the truth of this old tale: you are your own worst enemy.  Now it is a lesson he teaches others.
fields.description: Terrorblade brings forth an invulnerable dark illusion of the targeted enemy Hero. The enemy Hero is slowed and attacked by the illusion for a short duration.
fields.name: Reflection
fields.notes: Reflections are untargetable, invulnernable illusions. Reflections can only attack their source.

fields.lore: Temper, temper. The rage rises up and takes control.  Meet Terrorblade's own worst self.
fields.description: Terrorblade transforms into a powerful demon with a ranged attack.
fields.name: Metamorphosis

fields.lore: Temper, temper. The rage rises up and takes control.  Meet Terrorblade's own worst self.
fields.description: Terrorblade transforms into a powerful demon with a ranged attack.
fields.name: Metamorphosis

fields.lore: There's only one thing more dangerous than facing Terrorblade.  Facing MORE Terrrorblades!
fields.description: Creates an illusion of Terrorblade that deals damage.
fields.name: Conjure Image

fields.lore: Temper, temper. The rage rises up and takes control.  Meet Terrorblade's own worst self.
fields.description: Terrorblade transforms into a powerful demon with a ranged attack.
fields.name: Metamorphosis

fields.lore: You didn't need that life, did you?  The demon marauder steals that which you hold most dear.
fields.description: Severs the soul from both Terrorblade and a target hero, then exchanges them, carrying part of the units' life forces. The percentage hit points of each unit are switched with the souls. Some hit points must remain.
fields.name: Sunder

fields.lore: Even the Grandest Magus may use his powers for enjoyment.
fields.description: Rubick uses his telekinetic powers to lift the enemy into the air briefly and then hurls them back at the ground. The unit lands on the ground with such force that it stuns nearby enemies.
fields.name: Telekinesis
fields.notes: While the target is in the air, Rubick may use a secondary ability to throw the enemy in a targeted direction. When the unit lands, it isn't affected by the area of effect stun. The farthest you can throw an enemy is 375.

fields.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.
fields.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage.  Each jump deals less damage.
fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.
fields.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage.  Each jump deals less damage.
fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.name: Fade Bolt

fields.lore: ...but even their lesser magics can be a source of much utility.
fields.description:
Rubick studies the trace magical essence of one enemy hero, learning the secrets of the last spell the hero cast. Rubick can use this spell as his own for several minutes or until he dies.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Spell Steal
fields.notes: Cannot steal item abilities.

fields.lore: Not every magus can be a Grand Magus...
fields.description: Rubick's mastery of the arcane protects his allies against weaker magics, granting them magic resistance.
fields.name: Null Field
fields.notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

fields.lore: The saw-suit is equipped to react to the slightest touch with fortified defenses.
fields.description: Each time Timbersaw is attacked, he gains increased health regen and armor.
fields.name: Reactive Armor

fields.lore: You never know when you might need to escape from malevolent saplings.
fields.description: Timbersaw fires a chain that embeds itself in the first tree it hits, pulling him towards it.  Any enemy in the path takes damage.
fields.name: Timber Chain

fields.lore: In the case that Rizzrack gets surrounded by the the vines and plants of his nightmares, he has an immediate chainsaw defense.
fields.description: Timbersaw whirls extremely sharp edges, damaging enemies and destroying trees around him in an area.  If an enemy hero is affected, it loses some of its primary attribute for a short duration.  Whirling Death will deal Pure damage if a tree is cut down in the process.
fields.name: Whirling Death

fields.lore: You never know when you might need to escape from malevolent saplings.
fields.description: Timbersaw fires a chain that embeds itself in the first tree it hits, pulling him towards it.  Any enemy in the path takes damage.
fields.name: Timber Chain

fields.lore: In the case that Rizzrack gets surrounded by the the vines and plants of his nightmares, he has an immediate chainsaw defense.
fields.description: Timbersaw whirls extremely sharp edges, damaging enemies and destroying trees around him in an area.  If an enemy hero is affected, it loses some of its primary attribute for a short duration.  Whirling Death will deal Pure damage if a tree is cut down in the process.
fields.name: Whirling Death

fields.lore: The ultimate in anti-flora weaponry.
fields.description: Fires your main saw blade at the target location where it will spin in place, dealing damage in an area around it.  Additionally, for each 5% of health missing, enemies caught in the saw blade move more slowly. The blade deals damage and cuts down trees in its path when fired and retracted.  While active the ability costs mana, and you lose the ability to attack.
fields.name: Chakram
fields.notes: The Chakram will return if Timbersaw runs out of mana or moves over 2000 distance away.

fields.lore: Boush perfected this rock cutting laser in his subterranean laboratory, never considering its combat utility.
fields.description: Fires an intense energy beam, dealing damage and blinding the target for 3 seconds, causing it to miss all physical attacks. Its range is doubled with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Laser
fields.notes: The damage is dealt immediately while the miss effect is delayed until the projectile hits.

fields.lore: Even though the laboratory has since been sealed off, the ability to radio in robotic drones is still in working order.
fields.description: Enlists an army of robotic minions to destroy enemy units in an area around Tinker.
fields.name: March of the Machines
fields.notes: March of the Machines deals damage through magic immunity and hits mechanical units. Robots spawn at a rate of 24 per second.

fields.lore: Boush perfected this rock cutting laser in his subterranean laboratory, never considering its combat utility.
fields.description: Fires an intense energy beam, dealing damage and blinding the target for 3 seconds, causing it to miss all physical attacks. Its range is doubled with Aghanim's Scepter.

fields.name: Laser
fields.notes: The damage is dealt immediately while the miss effect is delayed until the projectile hits.

fields.lore: The last contraption Boush was able to save was a retrofitted rocket launcher with a homing mechanism.
fields.description: Launches a pair of rockets at the nearest visible enemy heroes within 2500 range. The number of missile targets is doubled with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Heat-Seeking Missile
fields.notes: Does not hit ethereal units.

fields.lore: A new battery here, another set of rockets there, Boush continually improves on existing technology.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Resets the cooldown on most of Tinker's items and abilities.
fields.name: Rearm
fields.notes: Rearm works on all items except Black King Bar, Arcane Boots, Helm of the Dominator, Hand of Midas, Refresher Orb, Linken's Sphere, and Necronomicon.

fields.lore: The last contraption Boush was able to save was a retrofitted rocket launcher with a homing mechanism.
fields.description: Launches a pair of rockets at the nearest visible enemy heroes within 2500 range. The number of missile targets is doubled with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Heat-Seeking Missile
fields.notes: Does not hit ethereal units.

fields.lore: The last contraption Boush was able to save was a retrofitted rocket launcher with a homing mechanism.
fields.description: Launches a pair of rockets at the nearest visible enemy heroes within 2500 range. The number of missile targets is doubled with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Heat-Seeking Missile
fields.notes: Does not hit ethereal units.

fields.description: Launches a pair of rockets at the nearest visible enemy heroes within 2500 range. The number of missile targets is doubled with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Heat-Seeking Missile
fields.notes: Does not hit ethereal units.

fields.lore: A self-defense incantation, Rhasta developed shackles after his master was slain in the Bleeding Hills.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Magically binds an enemy unit so that it cannot move or attack, while dealing damage over time.
fields.name: Shackles

fields.lore: Rhasta often ended performances by turning himself into a chicken - now, the humiliation is shared.
fields.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless creature, disabling their attacks and abilities.
fields.name: Hex
fields.notes: Instantly destroys illusions. The target will have a base movement speed of 100, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled. Hex disables damage block and evasion.

fields.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.
fields.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
fields.name: Ether Shock
fields.notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.

fields.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.
fields.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
fields.name: Ether Shock
fields.notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.

fields.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.
fields.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
fields.name: Ether Shock
fields.notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.

fields.lore: Snake charming was a big part of the Shadow Shaman's act; now Rhasta can empower the snakes to do his bidding.
fields.description:
Summons 10 serpent wards to attack enemy units and structures. The wards are immune to magic, and have a small area of splash damage that increases per level.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Mass Serpent Ward
fields.notes: Serpent Wards deal piercing type splash damage. Serpent Wards deal 100% damage in a 50/75/85 radius. Serpent Wards deal 40% damage in a 75/100/110 radius. Serpent Wards deal 20% damage in a 150/200/220 radius.

fields.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.
fields.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
fields.name: Ether Shock
fields.notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.

fields.lore: Rhasta often ended performances by turning himself into a chicken - now, the humiliation is shared.
fields.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless creature, disabling their attacks and abilities.
fields.name: Hex
fields.notes: Instantly destroys illusions. The target will have a base movement speed of 100, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled. Hex disables damage block and evasion.

fields.lore: Rhasta often ended performances by turning himself into a chicken - now, the humiliation is shared.
fields.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless creature, disabling their attacks and abilities.
fields.name: Hex
fields.notes: Instantly destroys illusions. The target will have a base movement speed of 100, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled. Hex disables damage block and evasion.

fields.lore: Krobelus' many trips to the grave gather a flock of the damned.
fields.description: Sends a swarm of winged beasts to savage enemy units in front of Death Prophet.
fields.name: Crypt Swarm
fields.notes: Can hit units up to 1110 range away.

fields.lore: Peering into the veil of her opponent's demise, Krobelus sees a silent future.
fields.description: Prevents enemy units in a target area from casting spells.
fields.name: Silence
fields.notes: Doesn't prevent usage of items.

fields.lore: Krobelus' many trips to the grave gather a flock of the damned.
fields.description: Sends a swarm of winged beasts to savage enemy units in front of Death Prophet.
fields.name: Crypt Swarm
fields.notes: Can hit units up to 1110 range away.

fields.lore: With each death, Krobelus adds necromantic power to her repertoire.
fields.description: Increases the potency of Death Prophet's spells, while providing a passive movement speed boost.  Reduces mana costs and cooldowns of Crypt Swarm and Silence, and adds additional spirits to Exorcism.
fields.name: Witchcraft

fields.lore: Krobelus' many trips to the grave gather a flock of the damned.
fields.description: Sends a swarm of winged beasts to savage enemy units in front of Death Prophet.
fields.name: Crypt Swarm
fields.notes: Can hit units up to 1110 range away.

fields.lore: Over time, the banshee remnants of her previous lives return to haunt the present.
fields.description: Unleashes evil spirits to drain the life of nearby enemy units and structures. At the end of the spell's duration, Death Prophet is healed in proportion to the damage dealt.  Lasts 30 seconds.
fields.name: Exorcism
fields.notes: Radius represents the area in which the spirits will acquire targets around Death Prophet. Spirit damage isn't reduced by damage block abilities.

fields.lore: Krobelus' many trips to the grave gather a flock of the damned.
fields.description: Sends a swarm of winged beasts to savage enemy units in front of Death Prophet.
fields.name: Crypt Swarm
fields.notes: Can hit units up to 1110 range away.

fields.lore: With each death, Krobelus adds necromantic power to her repertoire.
fields.description: Increases the potency of Death Prophet's spells, while providing a passive movement speed boost.  Reduces mana costs and cooldowns of Crypt Swarm and Silence, and adds additional spirits to Exorcism.
fields.name: Witchcraft

fields.lore: With each death, Krobelus adds necromantic power to her repertoire.
fields.description: Increases the potency of Death Prophet's spells, while providing a passive movement speed boost.  Reduces mana costs and cooldowns of Crypt Swarm and Silence, and adds additional spirits to Exorcism.
fields.name: Witchcraft

fields.lore: Locked away in the pocket between this world and the Outworld, victims realize their infantile knowledge and mortality.
fields.description: Places a target allied or enemy hero into an astral prison.  The hidden hero is invulnerable and disabled.  When cast on an enemy Hero, Harbinger temporarily steals intelligence from that hero.
fields.name: Astral Imprisonment
fields.notes: If used on an ally, no intelligence is stolen. Imprisoned units are hidden and invulnerable. Imprisoned units can still be hit by Sanity's Eclipse.

fields.lore: The crystals of the Outworld produce arcane power, and the Harbinger channels it into the world of mortals.
fields.description: Whenever nearby allied Heroes or Outworld Devourer itself casts a spell, it gains a chance to restore 25% of its mana pool.  Outworld Devourer also passively gains a bonus to its base mana pool.  Several skills with no cooldown and toggled spells cannot trigger Essence Aura.
fields.name: Essence Aura
fields.notes: Other than Arcane Orb, most skills without cooldowns cannot trigger Essence Aura.

fields.lore: Harbinger's outworldly knowledge allows it to tap into the ebb and flow of all spiritual energy, infusing it into his being.
fields.description:
Adds extra pure damage to Outworld Devourer's attacks, based on his remaining mana pool.  Arcane Orb also does bonus damage to summoned units and illusions.

Arcane Orb is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Arcane Orb
fields.notes: The damage is calculated after the mana cost is spent.

fields.lore: The crystals of the Outworld produce arcane power, and the Harbinger channels it into the world of mortals.
fields.description: Whenever nearby allied Heroes or Outworld Devourer itself casts a spell, it gains a chance to restore 25% of its mana pool.  Outworld Devourer also passively gains a bonus to its base mana pool.  Several skills with no cooldown and toggled spells cannot trigger Essence Aura.
fields.name: Essence Aura
fields.notes: Other than Arcane Orb, most skills without cooldowns cannot trigger Essence Aura.

fields.name: Essence Aura
fields.notes: Other than Arcane Orb, most skills without cooldowns cannot trigger Essence Aura.

fields.description: Whenever nearby allied Heroes or Outworld Devourer itself casts a spell, it gains a chance to restore 25% of its mana pool.  Outworld Devourer also passively gains a bonus to its base mana pool.  Several skills with no cooldown and toggled spells cannot trigger Essence Aura.
fields.name: Essence Aura

fields.lore: Locked away in the pocket between this world and the Outworld, victims realize their infantile knowledge and mortality.
fields.description: Places a target allied or enemy hero into an astral prison.  The hidden hero is invulnerable and disabled.  When cast on an enemy Hero, Harbinger temporarily steals intelligence from that hero.
fields.name: Astral Imprisonment
fields.notes: If used on an ally, no intelligence is stolen. Imprisoned units are hidden and invulnerable. Imprisoned units can still be hit by Sanity's Eclipse.

fields.lore: When an Outworld crystal ruptures, cataclysmic energies are released, and the reverberations of this power are felt interdimensionally.
fields.description:
Deals damage to enemy Heroes in an area of effect based on the difference between Harbinger and the affected Hero's intelligence. If the Hero takes less than the damage threshold, that Hero loses 75% of its current mana.  Sanity's Eclipse can hit units trapped in Astral Imprisonment.  If an enemy hero has the same or higher Intelligence than Outworld Devourer, Sanity's Eclipse has no effect.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Sanity's Eclipse

fields.lore: Harbinger's outworldly knowledge allows it to tap into the ebb and flow of all spiritual energy, infusing it into his being.
fields.description:
Adds extra pure damage to Outworld Devourer's attacks, based on his remaining mana pool.  Arcane Orb also does bonus damage to summoned units and illusions.

Arcane Orb is a Unique Attack Modifier, and does not stack with other Unique Attack Modifiers.
fields.name: Arcane Orb
fields.notes: The damage is calculated after the mana cost is spent.

fields.lore: When an Outworld crystal ruptures, cataclysmic energies are released, and the reverberations of this power are felt interdimensionally.
fields.description:
Deals damage to enemy Heroes in an area of effect based on the difference between Harbinger and the affected Hero's intelligence. If the Hero takes less than the damage threshold, that Hero loses 75% of its current mana.  Sanity's Eclipse can hit units trapped in Astral Imprisonment.  If an enemy hero has the same or higher Intelligence than Outworld Devourer, Sanity's Eclipse has no effect.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Sanity's Eclipse

fields.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.
fields.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
fields.name: Impale
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 700 range.

fields.lore: While their carapace is relatively thin, it's guarded by a retractable field of razor-sharp spikes.
fields.description: When activated, Spiked Carapace reflects and negates damage dealt to Nyx Assassin (max once from each source), as well as stunning the source of the damage.
fields.name: Spiked Carapace
fields.notes: The damage is calculated after all reductions. Spiked Carapace will only trigger on damage from other player controlled units.

fields.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.
fields.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
fields.name: Impale
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 700 range.

fields.lore: While their carapace is relatively thin, it's guarded by a retractable field of razor-sharp spikes.
fields.description: When activated, Spiked Carapace reflects and negates damage dealt to Nyx Assassin (max once from each source), as well as stunning the source of the damage.
fields.name: Spiked Carapace
fields.notes: The damage is calculated after all reductions. Spiked Carapace will only trigger on damage from other player controlled units.

fields.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.
fields.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
fields.name: Impale
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 700 range.

fields.lore: The scarab kills for the glory of his queen.
fields.description: Allows Nyx Assassin to become invisible and gain a speed bonus.  If Nyx Assassin attacks to break the invisibility, massive bonus damage is dealt with the attack.
fields.name: Vendetta
fields.notes: Has a 0 second fadetime. If a spell is used to break the invisibility, or the invisibility expires, the bonus damage is lost.

fields.lore: The tome in Ultimyr describes one scarab with the ability eat away at the mind of lesser beings.
fields.description: Destroys the target hero's mana equal to a multiplier of its Intelligence, and deals damage equal to the mana burned.
fields.name: Mana Burn

fields.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.
fields.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
fields.name: Impale
fields.notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 700 range.

fields.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.
fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.
fields.name: Sacred Arrow
fields.notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds. Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.

fields.lore: Both friend and foe alike recognize Mirana's iconic white beast in the heat of battle.
fields.description: Mirana leaps forward into battle, empowering allied units with a ferocious roar that grants bonus attack and movement speed. Speed bonus lasts 10 seconds.
fields.name: Leap
fields.notes: You can use Leap to dodge incoming projectiles.

fields.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.
fields.description: Fires an arrow with deadly precision, dealing large damage and stunning the first enemy unit it strikes. Stun duration increases based on distance to target, ranging from 0.5 to 5 seconds. Bonus damage up to 100 is applied based on distance to target.
fields.name: Sacred Arrow
fields.notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds. Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.

fields.lore: The Goddess breaks the strata to empower her Princess in the time of need.
fields.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. One random enemy unit in 175 range will take a second hit for 75% of the damage.
fields.name: Starstorm
fields.notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere. Starstorm cannot hit invisible units. Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.

fields.lore: The Goddess breaks the strata to empower her Princess in the time of need.
fields.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. One random enemy unit in 175 range will take a second hit for 75% of the damage.
fields.name: Starstorm
fields.notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere. Starstorm cannot hit invisible units. Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.

fields.lore: Her tenure with Selemene allows Mirana to eclipse the ground, wrapping her allies in a cloak of shadows.
fields.description: Turns Mirana and all allied heroes invisible. If Invisibility is broken, it will restore after fade delay if the shadow's duration has not expired.  Silence will stop Moonlight Shadow.
fields.name: Moonlight Shadow
fields.notes: Units affected will not auto attack enemies. Magic immune allies will be affected.

fields.lore: The Goddess breaks the strata to empower her Princess in the time of need.
fields.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. One random enemy unit in 175 range will take a second hit for 75% of the damage.
fields.name: Starstorm
fields.notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere. Starstorm cannot hit invisible units. Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.

fields.lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.
fields.description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy land units.
fields.name: Thunder Clap

fields.lore: When Mangix won his title as the Brewmaster of the Order of Oyo, he also claimed his place in the mastery of inebriation.
fields.description: Gives a chance to avoid attacks and to deal critical damage.
fields.name: Drunken Brawler
fields.notes: Does not stack with evasion from other sources.

fields.lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.
fields.description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy land units.
fields.name: Thunder Clap

fields.lore: The Order of the Oyo's solution to all problems - another round!
fields.description: Drenches a small area in alcohol, causing their movement speed to be reduced, and causing their attacks to have a chance to miss.
fields.name: Drunken Haze
fields.notes: Drunken Haze cannot be disjointed.

fields.lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.
fields.description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy land units.
fields.name: Thunder Clap

fields.lore: It isn't clear whether Mangix is consciously aware of his potent bond with nature, as it often occurs in the midst of a drunken stupor.
fields.description:
Splits Brewmaster into elements, forming 3 specialized warriors, adept at survival. If any of them survive until the end of their summoned timer, the Brewmaster is reborn.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Primal Split
fields.notes: The Earth Element will carry all auras that the Brewmaster has, as well as True Sight. When the spell ends, Brewmaster will take the place of an element in this order, assuming they are alive: Earth, Storm, Fire.

fields.lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.
fields.description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy land units.
fields.name: Thunder Clap

fields.lore: When Mangix won his title as the Brewmaster of the Order of Oyo, he also claimed his place in the mastery of inebriation.
fields.description: Gives a chance to avoid attacks and to deal critical damage.
fields.name: Drunken Brawler
fields.notes: Does not stack with evasion from other sources.

fields.lore: The Order of the Oyo's solution to all problems - another round!
fields.description: Drenches a small area in alcohol, causing their movement speed to be reduced, and causing their attacks to have a chance to miss.
fields.name: Drunken Haze
fields.notes: Drunken Haze cannot be disjointed.

fields.lore: When Mangix won his title as the Brewmaster of the Order of Oyo, he also claimed his place in the mastery of inebriation.
fields.description: Gives a chance to avoid attacks and to deal critical damage.
fields.name: Drunken Brawler
fields.notes: Does not stack with evasion from other sources.

fields.lore: Boush perfected this rock cutting laser in his subterranean laboratory, never considering its combat utility.
fields.description: Fires an intense energy beam, dealing damage and blinding the target for 3 seconds, causing it to miss all physical attacks. Its range is doubled with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Laser
fields.notes: The damage is dealt immediately while the miss effect is delayed until the projectile hits.

fields.lore: The last contraption Boush was able to save was a retrofitted rocket launcher with a homing mechanism.
fields.description: Launches a pair of rockets at the nearest visible enemy heroes within 2500 range. The number of missile targets is doubled with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Heat-Seeking Missile
fields.notes: Does not hit ethereal units.

fields.lore: Boush perfected this rock cutting laser in his subterranean laboratory, never considering its combat utility.

fields.name: Heat-Seeking Missile
fields.notes: Does not hit ethereal units.

fields.lore: Even though the laboratory has since been sealed off, the ability to radio in robotic drones is still in working order.
fields.description: Enlists an army of robotic minions to destroy enemy units in an area around Tinker.
fields.name: March of the Machines
fields.notes: March of the Machines deals damage through magic immunity and hits mechanical units. Robots spawn at a rate of 24 per second.

fields.lore: Even though the laboratory has since been sealed off, the ability to radio in robotic drones is still in working order.
fields.description: Enlists an army of robotic minions to destroy enemy units in an area around Tinker.
fields.name: March of the Machines
fields.notes: March of the Machines deals damage through magic immunity and hits mechanical units. Robots spawn at a rate of 24 per second.

fields.description: Enlists an army of robotic minions to destroy enemy units in an area around Tinker.
fields.name: March of the Machines
fields.notes: March of the Machines deals damage through magic immunity and hits mechanical units. Robots spawn at a rate of 24 per second.

fields.lore: A new battery here, another set of rockets there, Boush continually improves on existing technology.
fields.description: CHANNELED - Resets the cooldown on most of Tinker's items and abilities.
fields.name: Rearm
fields.notes: Rearm works on all items except Black King Bar, Arcane Boots, Helm of the Dominator, Hand of Midas, Refresher Orb, Linken's Sphere, and Necronomicon.

fields.description: Turns Mirana and all allied heroes invisible. If Invisibility is broken, it will restore after fade delay if the shadow's duration has not expired.  Silence will stop Moonlight Shadow.
fields.name: Moonlight Shadow
fields.notes: Units affected will not auto attack enemies. Magic immune allies will be affected.

fields.lore: Sometimes breaking one of the Riftshadow Crystals can be just the trick for getting yourself out of a bind.  Or your other self.
fields.description: Drawing mystical energies from the earth, a Meepo can teleport to another Meepo or itself after channeling for 1.5 seconds, dealing damage in both the departure and arrival locations.
fields.name: Poof
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap. Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

fields.lore: Catching dinner in the Riftshadow Ruins can be quite the task.
fields.description: Tosses a net at the target point, pinning down all enemy units.  Earthbind prevents invisibility, blink, and interrupts channeling.
fields.name: Earthbind
fields.notes: While preventing units from going invisible, Earthbind won't hit units that are already invisible. Does not work on magic immune units or Roshan.

fields.lore: Do I know you?
fields.description:
Meepo summons an imperfect, semi-autonomous duplicate of himself, which can gain gold and experience as he does and shares his experience and abilities. However, the clones cannot wield any items but the boots that Meepo himself wears.  If any of the clones die, they all die. Increases the speed at which you respawn. 

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Divided We Stand
fields.notes: Clones can't use Arcane Boots or pick up runes.

fields.lore: Sometimes breaking one of the Riftshadow Crystals can be just the trick for getting yourself out of a bind.  Or your other self.
fields.description: Drawing mystical energies from the earth, a Meepo can teleport to another Meepo or itself after channeling for 1.5 seconds, dealing damage in both the departure and arrival locations.
fields.name: Poof
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap. Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

fields.name: Poof
fields.notes: Can be cast through the minimap. Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

fields.lore: Keeping your pack light and having few but versatile tools is the best bet for survival.
fields.description: Meepo enchants his weapon to deal damage per second, as well as slow the movement speed of the attacked unit.  Geostrikes from multiple Meepos stack.
fields.name: Geostrike
fields.notes: Slows magic immune units.

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.
fields.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him immune to magic and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.  Lasts 5 seconds.
fields.name: Blade Fury
fields.notes: This skill doesn't affect mechanical units. You can use items during Blade Fury. If a unit is not being affected by Blade Fury, Juggernaut can perform normal attacks against this unit. Deals a total of 400/500/600/700 damage.

fields.lore: Of the rituals learned at the Isle of Masks, tending wounds with a bit of voodoo magic has proven to be quite useful.
fields.description: Summons a Healing Ward that heals all nearby allied units, based on their max hit points.  The Healing Ward can move at 450 movement speed after being summoned.  Lasts 25 seconds.
fields.name: Healing Ward
fields.notes: The healing ward can be controlled. Multiple healing wards don't stack.

fields.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.

fields.lore: 'The fruits of discipline; with practice comes strength.'
fields.description:
Juggernaut leaps towards the target enemy unit with a damaging attack, and then slashes other nearby enemy units, dealing between 175-250 damage per slash.  Juggernaut is invulnerable for the duration.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Omnislash
fields.notes: Interrupts channeling spells of the primary target. Can target magic immune units. Slashes happen on an interval of 0.4 seconds. Creeps are killed in one hit of omnislash. You can use items during Omnislash.

fields.lore: Playing with electricity can have unexpected results.
fields.description: Teleports the target hero back to where it was 4 seconds ago.  Instantly kills illusions.
fields.name: Glimpse
fields.notes: The travel time is a function of the distance the target will travel.

fields.lore: Disruptor's charged coils occasionally overload, and a singed armor plate or tuft of fur is the enemy's result.
fields.description: Repeatedly strikes the targeted unit with lightning.  Each strike damages nearby enemy units in a small radius.
fields.name: Thunder Strike

fields.lore: The stryder is immune to the gale-force winds that will consume its adversaries.
fields.description: After a short formation time, creates a circular barrier of kinetic energy that enemies can't pass.
fields.name: Kinetic Field
fields.notes: Magic immune units can travel through the field.

fields.lore: A summer squall in Druud is a hardship that only an Oglodi can survive.
fields.description:
Creates a damaging static storm that also silences all enemy units in the area for the duration.  The damage starts off weak, but increases in power over the duration.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.

fields.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.
fields.description: Slark leaps forward, grabbing the first hero he connects with.  That unit takes damage and is leashed to Slark, and can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
fields.name: Pounce
fields.notes: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of 933.33, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled 700 distance. Magic immune units cannot be leashed. Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location. Blinking or teleporting can break the leash.

fields.lore: With each strike at his adversaries, Slark's knowledge of their weaknesses improves.
fields.description: Slark steals the life essence of enemy heroes with his attacks, draining each of their attributes and converting them to bonus Agility.
fields.name: Essence Shift
fields.notes: Attributes cannot be dropped below 1. When either Slark or the affected unit dies, the stats are returned to normal.

fields.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.
fields.description: Slark leaps forward, grabbing the first hero he connects with.  That unit takes damage and is leashed to Slark, and can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
fields.name: Pounce
fields.notes: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of 933.33, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled 700 distance. Magic immune units cannot be leashed. Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location. Blinking or teleporting can break the leash.

fields.lore: Slithereen are capable of quickly regrowing appendages, in case of critical injury, to save their own lives.
fields.description: After a short delay, Slark sacrifices some of his life blood, purging negative debuffs and dealing damage to enemy units around him and to himself.  Slark only takes 50% of the damage.
fields.name: Dark Pact
fields.notes: 1.5 seconds after cast, a series of 10 pulses separated by 0.1 seconds deal the damage. Each pulse also removes buffs from Slark. You can't kill yourself with this skill. The pulses stop if Slark dies.

fields.lore: The hidden Thirteenth is a slippery foe.
fields.description: When used, Slark hides himself in a cloud of shadows, becoming immune to detection (attacking, casting spells, and using items do not reveal Slark).  Passively, when not visible to the enemy team, Slark gains bonus movement speed and health regeneration.
fields.name: Shadow Dance
fields.notes: If Slark is damaged by a neutral unit, the effect is lost for 2 seconds.

fields.description: Allows manipulation of ice elements and grants a permanent strength bonus. Each Quas instance provides increased health regeneration.
fields.name: Quas
fields.notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

fields.lore: So begins a new age of knowledge.
fields.description:
Combines the properties of the elements currently being manipulated, creating a new spell at the Invoker's disposal. Click the help button to see the list of possible spells.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Invoke
fields.notes: The arrangement of instances does not matter.

fields.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.
fields.description: Converts an area of trees into Treants. Treants have 550 hit points and deal 21-23 damage.
fields.name: Nature's Call
fields.notes: Nature's Call can only create as many trees there are in the target area. Treants have 20% magic resistance.

fields.lore: The Prophet keeps his sentinel over the forest, protecting it when in need.
fields.description: Teleports to any point on the map.
fields.name: Teleportation
fields.notes: Teleport takes 3 seconds to cast. Mana and cooldown take effect when the cast is completed.  Nature's Prophet will not use any mana or waste the cooldown if the spell is interrupted while casting. When the cast begins, an effect is created at the target location, which is visible to allies and enemies.

fields.lore: Verdant overgrowth is a common ailment reported by Nature's Prophet's attackers.
fields.description: Sprouts a ring of trees around a unit, trapping it in place.
fields.name: Sprout
fields.notes: Sprout can be cast on any unit, or the ground. Trees created by Sprout have the same interactions with abilities as regular trees.

fields.lore: Nature's Prophet calls Verodicia's fury to strike down those who might ravage the wilderness.
fields.description:
Damaging energy bounces around the map, striking enemies close to the cast point that are in vision. Each enemy hit beyond the first adds damage.

Upgradable with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Wrath of Nature
fields.notes: Wrath of Nature will not hit units out of vision. Can be cast through the minimap; the nearest valid target will be selected.

fields.notes: Teleport takes 3 seconds to cast. Mana and cooldown take effect when the cast is completed.  Nature's Prophet will not use any mana or waste the cooldown if the spell is interrupted while casting. When the cast begins, an effect is created at the target location, which is visible to allies and enemies.

fields.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.
fields.description: Converts an area of trees into Treants. Treants have 550 hit points and deal 21-23 damage.
fields.name: Nature's Call
fields.notes: Nature's Call can only create as many trees there are in the target area. Treants have 20% magic resistance.

fields.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.
fields.description: Converts an area of trees into Treants. Treants have 550 hit points and deal 21-23 damage.
fields.name: Nature's Call
fields.notes: Nature's Call can only create as many trees there are in the target area. Treants have 20% magic resistance.

fields.lore: Nature's Prophet calls Verodicia's fury to strike down those who might ravage the wilderness.
fields.description:
Damaging energy bounces around the map, striking enemies close to the cast point that are in vision. Each enemy hit beyond the first adds damage.

Upgradable with Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Wrath of Nature
fields.notes: Wrath of Nature will not hit units out of vision. Can be cast through the minimap; the nearest valid target will be selected.

fields.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
fields.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
fields.name: Nether Blast
fields.notes: Damage is delayed by 0.9 seconds.

fields.lore: A now-mastered relic from his childhood, Pugna delights in banishing others into the Nether Realm, whether for good, evil, or simple enjoyment.
fields.description: A powerful banishing spell that slows a unit and renders it unable to attack or be attacked. Afflicted units take extra magic damage.
fields.name: Decrepify
fields.notes: Only magical and pure damage can affect a unit under the effects of Decrepify.

fields.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
fields.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
fields.name: Nether Blast
fields.notes: Damage is delayed by 0.9 seconds.

fields.lore: While at the lamasery for the Arts of Oblivion, Pugna learned to dominate his classmates with a simple ward charged with Nether magic.
fields.description: Pugna places a nether ward that fires mana flares at enemy heroes who dare to cast spells, while also preventing them from regenerating mana.  Nether Ward deals damage equal to the damage multiplier times the mana spent by the enemy hero.  Lasts 25 seconds.
fields.name: Nether Ward
fields.notes: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect. Nether Ward can be decrepified. Nether Ward has 3 HP. Heroes can attack it for 1 damage, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.

fields.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
fields.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
fields.name: Nether Blast
fields.notes: Damage is delayed by 0.9 seconds.

fields.lore: Pugna has truly become more powerful than even the grandmaster of Oblivion.
fields.description:
CHANNELED - While channelling Life Drain, Pugna siphons HP of the target enemy unit. If you are full HP, it will restore mana instead. Lasts 10 seconds.

Upgradable by Aghanim's Scepter.
fields.name: Life Drain
fields.notes: HP drained depends on the actual damage dealt. Illusions are destroyed on the first tick of damage.

fields.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
fields.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
fields.name: Nether Blast
fields.notes: Damage is delayed by 0.9 seconds.

fields.name: Nether Ward
fields.notes: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect. Nether Ward can be decrepified. Nether Ward has 3 HP. Heroes can attack it for 1 damage, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.

fields.notes: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect. Nether Ward can be decrepified. Nether Ward has 3 HP. Heroes can attack it for 1 damage, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.
